Location: Hamilton, Ontario Onsite 5 days a week Role Summary The Intern, Radiochemistry will gain valuable lab experience working on radiolabeling productions for a range of targeting moieties (small molecules to mAbs) and radioisotopes in support of the Radioconjugate Discovery team. This role is an on site, lab position in Fusion’s Hamilton, Ontario facility. Accountabilities/Responsibilities: In lab position contributing to the preparation, purification and characterization of radioconjugates including stability assessments Collection and analysis and interpreting data Gain experience effectively communicating scientific data, which may come in the form of writing reports, papers and/or presentations Gain experience working within the radiochemistry function as a member of a multi-disciplinary collaborative discovery team Maintain clear and current records of work Qualifications: Driven University student currently enrolled in a chemistry, radiochemistry or a related field program (BSc or MSc) Strong communication skills and attention to detail, including proficiency in the English language Excellent troubleshooting skills in the lab, organizational skills and an understanding of the radiopharmaceutical field is an asset Demonstrable independent research accomplishments is an advantage Knowledge of good laboratory practices is an asset Demonstrated ability to successfully prioritize tasks and manage timelines Experience in the safe handling of radioisotopes and prior radiation safety training is an asset Experience with bioconjugations and medicinal synthetic chemistry is an asset Availability to work full-time for duration of the internship What you’ll Learn: As an Intern at AstraZeneca Canada you will have the opportunity to learn about various positions with AstraZeneca as you work cross-functionally with different parts of our business. Our purpose for this position is to ensure you gain key foundational knowledge that will complement your education through interesting work while leveraging valuable networking opportunities to expand your learning. You will be invited to attend various learning events including Town Halls, Industry Spotlight sessions Science Matters presentations, employee engagement events as well as many others so you will be well-prepared and qualified for future positions with AstraZeneca. We have a strong track record in developing and coaching interns to be successful for future positions at AstraZeneca. Join us and thrive in a place where the brightest and most curious minds come together to unlock the potential of what science can do! What to Expect: This role is a 4-month paid contract position, which starts in May 2026. Our position will be based in our Hamilton, Ontario laboratories. About AstraZeneca Canada: At AstraZeneca, we are united by a common purpose – to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines. This purpose underpins everything we do; our work helps to make hearts healthier, to help people breathe easier, and to help more people survive cancer. Every single day, we make a difference by delivering potentially life-changing medicines to millions of people worldwide and by leading breakthrough science that promises to transform the treatment of disease. Our purpose is bold and so is our approach. Becoming a more agile and innovative company means creating a vibrant, dynamic culture where we celebrate entrepreneurial thinking and act quickly to inspire change. We are courageous, taking smart risks and learning from both success and failure. We are curious, creative, and open to new insights and ways of working. Above all, we are passionate about science and driven to always put patients first. Join us and be part of a great place to work; an environment that energizes and empowers each of us to achieve our goal to develop and deliver medicines. Great People want to Work with us! Find out why: GTAA Top Employer Award for 10 years Top 100 Employers Award Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture Learn more about working with us in Canada View our YouTube channel Are you interested in working at AZ, apply today! title: Regulatory Affairs Associate - Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolism

description.text: Regulatory Affairs Associate - Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolism Location: Warsaw, hybrid work (3 days per week from office) Are you passionate about science and have or would like to get experience within regulatory affairs ? Do you want to be part of a cross functional and global team , applying your administrative skills in a science focused environment and grow your expertise within Regulatory Affairs Management ? Then join us to discover future treatments of Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolic (CVRM) diseases! At AstraZeneca, we are more than 65.000 people in over 100 countries. Our aim is simply to positively impact patients’ lives together, as our pipeline of innovative medicines consistently grows. As an industry leading Regulatory function, we’re focused and committed to the development of our products as well as to our people. We provide an open and supportive space to explore, learn and develop across all regulatory roles and levels, with the aspiration to make AstraZeneca the place to build your career in Regulatory. The role We are now looking for a new members to join our Regulatory Affairs Management team within the CVRM the rapeutic areas , in the roles as Regulatory Affairs Associate (RAA). What you’ll do The Regulatory Affairs Associate assists other members of Regulatory Affairs Management group in obtaining and maintaining licenses and applications in accordance with agreed regulatory strategy and AstraZeneca standards. This role is crucial in ensuring compliance and supporting the regulatory processes that enable our innovative treatments to reach patients. The CVRM Regulatory Affairs Management group sits within the AstraZeneca Late-Stage Development CVRM organisation and is accountable for end to end delivery of regulatory submissions in line with business priorities by providing regulatory expertise , efficient project management and strong leadership. Your main accountabilities / responsibilities : Document management including uploading and tracking regulatory files and systems according to established AZ procedures and regulatory requirements Working with setting up submissions in Electronic Regulatory Vault (ERV) Planning, preparing and executing simple submissions, and assisting with the preparation and planning of regulatory dispatches. Be the interface with Health Authority (HA) and its systems for designated regulatory tasks e.g. management of user fees, receipt of incoming FDA correspondence, ordering EudraCT number, EudraLink support, use of HA Portals. Responsible for the ordering and tracking of specific regulatory requirements such as registration samples, Legal documentation e.g. Letters of Authorisation , Powers of Attorney, Translations of regulatory documentation Provide support across the group for assigned non-drug project roles & responsibilities e.g. act as a designated point of contact or superuser Provide coaching, mentoring and knowledge sharing within the RAM skill group Contribute to process improvement Do you have the essential qualifications for th is role? Excellent written and verbal communication skills Organized with project management skills Experience in document management and tracking databases Aptitude to learn new systems quickly Cultural awareness Proficiency with common document management tools Ability to work independently and as part of a team It is an advantage if you have knowledge and experience of: Relevant qualification and/or experience in science, administration or IT 1-6 years of relevant experience from biopharmaceutical industry, or other relevant experience Some regulatory/medical/technical experience Experience with Veeva Vault Some regulatory/medical/technical experience Date Posted 09-Feb-2026 Closing Date 19-Feb-2026 AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. Position: Respiratory Account Specialist Location: Field-based UK Territory: Devon & Cornwall Are you ready to redefine respiratory care by combining clinical credibility with commercial excellence? In this role, you’ll lead integrated account strategy across hospital and primary care, using omnichannel engagement and NHS insights to unlock access, accelerate adoption and improve patient pathways. You’ll work in a fast‑moving, data‑informed team alongside medical and market access colleagues to turn insights into action—shaping local guidelines, advancing patient outcomes and delivering measurable business impact. Your work connects science and technology to the evolving needs of patients, healthcare professionals and system partners. Accountabilities Develop and deliver hospital and primary care account plans to drive adoption and growth. Use digital, virtual and in‑person channels aligned to customer journeys. Prioritise key accounts, pathways and decision makers. Partner with RHM to secure formulary and support guideline/pathway changes. Engage effectively across face‑to‑face and virtual settings to open access. Be the respected respiratory expert with NHS customers and colleagues. Keep patient outcomes central to HCP interactions. Share insights and involve medical colleagues when needed. Use sales data and NHS datasets (e.g., RightCare, HES) to identify opportunities with clear ROI. Meet KPIs, deliver regional sales targets and execute agreed projects. Map stakeholders and mobilise advocates across secondary care and PCNs. Essential criteria Qualified to ‘A’ level standard or equivalent Full driving license ABPI qualified Successful sales experience, including primary & secondary both F2F & virtual Presenting with strong interpersonal, communication and influencing skills Strong NHS knowledge and understanding Strong result focus Desirable criteria Degree qualified Knowledge of the customer and therapy area Strong IT and analytical skills Market access experience Interested? Introduction to role: Are you ready to lead the charge in transforming patient safety through evidence synthesis? AstraZeneca is seeking a dynamic Safety Evidence Synthesis Manager to join our Safety Epidemiology team. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for conducting targeted and systematic literature reviews, critical appraisals, and AI-assisted evidence synthesis. You will also play a key role in establishing best practices across the organization. Your work will drive scientific and operational execution of evidence synthesis and literature reviews that support post-marketing commitments and contextualization projects. Collaborate with Global Patient Safety, Global Regulatory, Global and Local Medical teams, and R&D to shape strategy, align objectives, and deliver high-quality, decision-ready outputs. Accountabilities Author and govern protocols: design and write protocols for rapid, scoping, and systematic reviews, as well as meta analyses, ensuring methodological robustness and alignment with regulatory expectations. Execute and oversee reviews: lead development of search strategies; supervise and perform study screening, data extraction, evidence synthesis, quality/risk of bias assessment, and report writing for patient safety–focused questions. Deliver ad hoc reviews and appraisals: conduct targeted literature assessments and critical appraisals of published safety studies related to medicinal products and devices; communicate findings with clear implications for pharmacovigilance and risk management. Essential Skills/Experience PhD (or equivalent) in epidemiology, public health, or related health science with substantial evidence synthesis experience; or MSc/MPH with extensive expertise in systematic reviews. Hands-on experience planning, conducting, and delivering systematic and ad hoc literature reviews end to end. Advanced skill in critical appraisal of study designs and published literature using established appraisal tools and reporting guidelines. Experience synthesizing, interpreting, and communicating published literature and medical information on drug and patient safety, including adverse event reporting. Desirable Skills/Experience Strong commitment to advancing the quality and impact of literature reviews and evidence synthesis in drug safety. Broad knowledge of patient safety, drug safety, epidemiology, and medical terminology. Experience collaborating with internal and external experts, collaborative groups, and contract research organizations (CROs). description.text: Scientist, Analytical Sciences Introduction to role We are looking for an experienced Scientist to join Analytical Operations within Analytical Sciences, Cell Therapy Development and Operations. This position is focused on the development and optimization of the genomic assay testing function to support process and product characterization of engineered cell therapy. The Scientist will work with Analytical Development, Process Development, and Quality Control to deliver quality data by maintaining continuous operations of genomic assay testing functions. You will have expertise in genomic assays, particularly those relevant to DNA extraction, digital PCR, qPCR, and RNP activity. This role is on-site in Santa Monica, CA and reports to a Senior Scientist within Analytical Sciences. Accountabilities Lead the development of operational processes & continuous improvement of the genomic function within Analytical Operations. Manage critical reagent inventory, assay control material, and general consumables to maintain team’s capabilities to execute genomic assays. Perform genomic assays including, but not limited to, DNA/RNA extraction, digital PCR, qPCR, and RNP activity assays. Maintain sample identity from sample source to molecular derivatives and its associated results. Coordinate to produce assay control materials with Process Engineers or External Suppliers and characterize material in a timely manner to support routine testing. Lead in the method transfer of genomic assays into the Analytical Operations team by assessing incoming test methods, critical reagents, and training schedule. Collaborate with method & automation developers to optimize methods for high throughput testing and streamline documentation & analysis. Maintain records of executed methods and reported results for samples and assay control material. Monitor assay trending and collaborate with method developers to troubleshoot analytical assays. Expand laboratory and operational skills to support department needs Provide technical mentorship ensuring scientific rigor and operational excellence in the lab. Maintain laboratory instruments, ensuring calibration, maintenance, and troubleshooting are performed. Essential Skills/Experience Three (3) years with BS/BA, or two (2) years with MS/MA in immunology, Cell Biology, Oncology, Molecular Biology, or a related discipline with experience in a biotechnology, biopharmaceutical, or academic setting. Strong expertise in genomic assays, especially those pertaining to human sample derivatives, digital PCR, and qPCR. Hands-on experience with media preparations and suspension/adherent culture work: thaw, culture, expand, and cryopreserve Proficiency in immune cell culture, including primary T cells or engineered immune cells. Proficiency in data analysis and troubleshooting of genomic analytical assays Proficient knowledge of general cell therapy processes and understanding of sampling and testing points for characterization to support process development Experience in flow cytometry, immunoassay, or cell-based assays is a plus Ability to clearly convey scientific findings and development rationale. Desirable Skills/Experience Working knowledge of protein purification technologies and common analytical methods (e.g., SEC-UPLC, LC-MS, SDS-PAGE, CE). Familiarity with lab automation scheduling software; Green Button Go preferred. Basic scripting for data handling (e.g., Python, Jupyter) is a plus, not required. Exposure to imaging or flow cytometry platforms and analysis tools (iQue, Attune, FlowJo) is beneficial for specific assays but not central to the role. AstraZeneca offers an inspiring environment where you can apply your expertise in new ways. We thrive on change and embrace the unknowns, taking calculated risks to deliver new medicines to patients. description.text: Location: Hamilton, Ontario Onsite 5 days/week Fusion Pharmaceuticals, a member of the AstraZeneca Group, is a clinical-stage oncology company focused on developing next-generation radioconjugates (RCs) as precision medicines. Fusion connects alpha particle emitting isotopes to various targeting molecules to selectively deliver the alpha emitting payloads to tumors. Fusion’s clinical portfolio includes: FPI-2265 targeting prostate specific membrane antigen (PSMA) for metastatic castration resistant prostate cancer currently in a Phase 2 trial; FPI-1434 targeting insulin-like growth factor 1 receptor currently in a Phase 1 trial; FPI-2059, a small molecule targeting neurotensin receptor 1 (NTSR1), currently in a Phase 1 trial; and FPI-2068, a bispecific IgG-based EGFR-cMET targeted radioconjugate currently in a Phase 1 trial. In addition, Fusion is pursuing combination programs between RCs and DNA Damage Response Inhibitors (DDRis) and immune-oncology agents. Fusion has a fully operational Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) compliant state-of-the-art radiopharmaceutical manufacturing facility to meet supply demand for Fusion's growing pipeline of RCs. Responsibilities and job tasks (including, but not limited to): Effectively execute routine radiolabeling productions for a range of targeting moieties (small molecules to mAbs) and radioisotopes in support of biological studies as a part of the Discovery team Contribute to the preparation, purification and characterization of novel radioconjugates including stability assessments Assist in the synthesis of radiolabeling precursors as required Analyze and interpret data Maintain clear and current records of work within a laboratory notebook Contribute to the organization and maintenance of all chemistry laboratories including waste streams in collaboration with operations and health physics teams Effectively communicate scientific findings, which may come in the form of writing reports and presentations Qualifications B.S. required, M.S. desired with 2-5 years of relevant laboratory experience Driven radiochemist with a recognized post-secondary education in radiochemistry, inorganic chemistry, organometallic chemistry or a related discipline Experience with bioconjugations and medicinal synthetic chemistry is also desirable Experience in performing in vitro assays with radioconjugates is desirable Excellent troubleshooting skills in the lab, organizational skills and an understanding of the radiopharmaceutical field Experience with analytical HPLC method development and Empower software Proven ability to work independently with strong communication skills and attention to detail, including proficiency in the English language Demonstrable independent research accomplishments Excel at working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment as a member of a multidisciplinary team Knowledge of good laboratory practices is an asset Demonstrated ability to successfully prioritize tasks and manage timelines Experience in the safe handling and analysis of radiometal conjugates is desirable WHY JOIN US? At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients, and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth, and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare. title: Senior Analyst I, Clinical Trial Safety

description.text: Location: Durham, NC Hybrid Policy: 3 Days onsite/week At AstraZeneca, we pride ourselves on crafting a collaborative culture that champions knowledge-sharing, ambitious thinking and innovation – ultimately providing employees with the opportunity to work across teams, functions and even the globe. Our dedication to sustainability is also central to our culture and part of what makes AstraZeneca a great place to work. We know the health of people, the planet and our business are interconnected which is why we’re taking ambitious action to tackle some of the biggest challenges of our time, from climate change to access to healthcare and disease prevention. Job Description: The Trial Safety Review Center (TRISARC) is a department in the Research and Development function of AstraZeneca. The primary remit of the TRISARC is to review large amounts of medical (mainly safety) data flowing through the clinical trial environment in order to ensure patient data is complete and medically accurate thus allowing study physicians and clinical/project scientists to interpret safety data efficiently. The Senior Analyst I, Clinical Trial Safety is responsible for tools set-up, scripting, and data analysis tasks for the Clinical Trial Safety. The Senior Analyst I works closely with all level Analysts & Scientists, Clinical Trial Safety to ensure safety data deliverables are executed per pre-defined plans and up to quality and timelines. The Senior Analyst I is adept at utilizing the Center’s Data Review tools of choice and should possess programming experience Typical Accountabilities: Ensure the Data Review tool is fit for purpose through set-up, maintenance and close-out of study according to agreed Best Practice procedures – to allow for handling of safety data and review for medical completeness and medical accuracy Generate high quality Clinical/Safety Data Review reports that are aligned for TRISARC members and the Global Therapeutic Areas Work with data outputs (i.e. generate reports, macros/scripts) from multiple sources such as the clinical database, external labs, ECG providers, and other safety vendors as appropriate. Generate summary reports, Analyze and visualize clinical data from different sources including but not limited to eCRF, external lab, clinical databases. Take on ad-hoc tasks as assigned by the TRISARC Leadership team members Provide input into non-drug project work including training activities, continuous improvement, and development of procedures as needed Work closely with IT and R&D Information functions to align on tool maintenance and tool improvement; provide customer feedback from the end user (TRISARC Safety Specialists, Study Physicians, Clinical Scientists) Expert on data analysis and visualization Supports development of data review tool applicable for TRISARC. Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience: Essential: Bachelor degree in related discipline Minimum one year of experience working on clinical studies in the Biotech/Pharma/CRO industry or equivalent Proven organizational and analytical skills Understanding of the clinical study and drug development process Knowledge of ICH/GCP Guidelines Knowledge of SAE reporting requirements Proven ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks with conflicting deadlines Ability to work independently, as well as in a team environment Independently designing and planning own work Managing change and uncertainty for self Advanced computer skills (Microsoft Outlook, Excel and Microsoft Power Platform) Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English Exhibit of AZ Values and Behaviours Desired: Relevant industry or health care experience Demonstrates ability and willingness to work and lead cross-functionally, e.g. with internal and external partners, on global studies, across different phases of drug development or different therapy areas Good understanding of clinical data flow Strong attention-to-detail, analytical skills, and ability to concisely summarize large amounts of complex information Programming experience in data analysis and/or data mining set-up (e.g. Python, R, SAS) Experience using data review tools such as JReview, JMP Clinical, or Spotfire Statistic knowledge Are you interested in working at AZ, apply today! WHY JOIN US? Transform billions of patients’ lives through technology, data, and innovative ways of working. You’re disruptive, decisive, and transformative. Someone excited to use technology to improve patients’ health. We’re building a new Health-tech business – Evinova, a fully-owned subsidiary of AstraZeneca Group. Evinova delivers market-leading digital health solutions that are science-based, evidence-led, and human experience-driven. Thoughtful risks and quick decisions come together to accelerate innovation across the life sciences sector. Be part of a diverse team that pushes the boundaries of science by digitally empowering a deeper understanding of the patients we’re helping. Launch pioneering digital solutions that improve the patients’ experience and deliver better health outcomes. Together, we have the opportunity to combine deep scientific expertise with digital and artificial intelligence to serve the wider healthcare community and create new standards across the sector. Recognizing the importance of individualized flexibility, our ways of working allow employees to balance personal and work commitments while ensuring we continue to create a strong culture of collaboration and teamwork by engaging face-to-face in our offices 3 days a week. About the Opportunity: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Clinical Solution Analyst to join our Clinical Solution Delivery team. This customer-facing role is responsible for translating study protocols into high-quality study builds and serving as the product subject matter expert to both the Evinova study team and our customers. You will operate at the intersection of product expertise and study execution for our customers, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to optimize clinical trial delivery and ensure exceptional outcomes. In addition, you will work alongside our product team, providing valuable input on feature development and enhancements that support our mission to deliver market-leading digital health solutions. This role will serve as the product subject matter expert within the Delivery organization, ensuring accurate study design and configuration for clinical trials. This position requires deep experience in clinical study setup, strong leadership capabilities, and a passion for understanding product functionality and industry best practices. You will champion best practices, influence improvements, and foster a culture of innovation and excellence across the team. What You'll Do: Customer Delivery : Drive study design, requirements gathering, and configuration activities for customer projects to ensure successful delivery of clinical trials. Product Subject Matter Expertise : Serve as the product SME within the Delivery organization for product capabilities, maintaining deep knowledge of configuration workflows and industry standards. Expert in End-to-End Delivery : Ensure delivery excellence across all phases of study execution, from planning to go-live, leveraging deep understanding of the full delivery lifecycle. Cross-Functional Collaboration : Work closely with other members of Delivery leadership and Product teams to improve processes, influence enhancements, and align on strategic goals. Identify opportunities to optimize study setup processes and implement best practices across the team. Pre-Sales Support: Partner as needed with the Commercial team to assess solution feasibility, ensuring proposed configurations align with product capabilities and delivery timelines. Training : Participate in the development of sharing product knowledge and study design expertise within the team and across delivery functions. Industry Insight : Stay informed on clinical trial trends and regulatory requirements to guide team practices and product input. Risk Management : Proactively identify risks in study delivery and implement mitigation strategies to ensure successful outcomes. Essential Skills/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences, Health Informatics, or related field. Proven experience working with clinical trial technologies to design and/or implement solutions. Extensive hands-on experience delivering clinical studies, including leading study design, requirements gathering, and configuration activities. Ability to interpret and apply study protocols accurately to system design and configuration. Skilled in conducting software demonstrations and explaining complex functionality to diverse stakeholders. Deep understanding of the competitive landscape and industry standards for clinical trial technology and product functionality. Strong knowledge of end-to-end delivery processes for clinical trials and digital health platforms. Excellent leadership, mentoring, and communication skills, with the ability to influence cross-functional teams. Experience collaborating with Product, Engineering, and Commercial teams to provide input on solution feasibility and product enhancements. Hands-on experience with Jira. Familiarity with SOP/WI development and audit readiness; experience supporting internal and external audits. SO, WHAT’S NEXT? To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience – it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them. Where can I find out more? Are you ready to shape the voice of a fast-growing, science-led company across diverse markets and influence decisions that improve patients’ lives? As Senior Director, International Communications, you will set the regional communications vision and translate it into action that elevates our reputation, engages our people, and strengthens the performance of our business. You will be the architect and accelerator of how we communicate at scale, helping our enterprise become increasingly tech-enabled and data-informed. Working closely with senior leaders, you will modernize how we tell our story, drive consistency and efficiency through smart frameworks and tools, and unlock the power of proactive storytelling across countries. How will you raise the bar for communications capability and inspire leaders across cultures to champion a shared narrative? What you’ll do Define and own the International communications strategy aligned to regional business priorities and global Corporate Affairs direction, ensuring clear objectives and measurable impact. Set standards, frameworks and tools that “level up” communications excellence across markets, creating a learning environment that advances skills and best-practice sharing. Partner across the Regional Corporate Affairs leadership team to strengthen integrated capabilities, culture, productivity and the value delivered to the business. Represent International markets on the Global Corporate Communications Taskforce, shaping global strategies with insights from the region and ensuring two-way alignment. Provide strategic counsel to senior leadership, including the International Executive Vice President and International Leadership Team, to guide decision-making and enterprise-wide messaging. Manage the International communications budget to optimize resources against strategic priorities and return on investment. Oversee reputation measurement and proactive management, translating research and tracking data into actionable insights for leaders. Develop and amplify corporate communications strategies and content—campaigns, narratives, speaker decks, infographics and videos—that highlight our impact on people, society and the planet. Act as a brand ambassador, ensuring alignment with global guidelines while enabling regional relevance and market-level localization. Lead issues and crisis communications preparedness and response, delivering clear recommendations, statements, reports and Q&As. Direct internal communications for the region, including executive engagement planning, change communications and channel strategy to strengthen connection and clarity. Orchestrate communications for major moments—quarterly results, senior leader meetings, leadership country visits, campaigns and town halls—so messages land with precision and momentum. Essential for the role Accountable for the International communications strategy as part of the Regional Corporate Affairs strategy, aligned with the International business strategy and global Corporate Affairs strategy Lead in continually levelling up communications capabilities across International markets, by setting clear standards and expectations, developing frameworks/tools to support excellence, engaging business leaders and creating an environment to support learning, development and best practice sharing As part of the core Regional Corporate Affairs leadership team, collaborate to improve the integrated capabilities, culture, productivity, efficiency and impact/value of the wider Corporate Affairs team Represent International markets and be a visible, active contributor on the Global Corporate Communications Taskforce, providing valuable insights and shaping global strategies and approaches Provide strategic communications counsel to senior leadership, especially the International Executive Vice President (member of AZ’s Senior Executive Team) and the cross-functional International Leadership Team Manage the International communications budget, ensuring appropriate allocation of resources Oversee the measurement and proactive management of AZ’s reputation, partnering with research agencies, leveraging tracking tools and providing actionable insights to senior leadership Develop and amplify corporate communications strategies and content, including campaigns, narratives, speaker decks, infographics and videos, to drive proactive storytelling on our impact on people, society and planet in our markets Act as a corporate brand ambassador, ensuring consistency with global brand guidelines, ensuring regional/market relevance and supporting localisation of AZ’s brand positioning Support visits by the Senior Executive Team to countries within the region Support crisis and issues management, preparing communications recommendations and content, including reactive statements, reports and Q&As Oversee internal communications strategy for the region, including International Executive Vice President engagement planning and communications, change management and channel management/development Support the delivery of major global and international milestones, including quarterly results updates, senior leader meetings, leadership country visits, campaigns and town halls Desirable for the role Senior communications leadership across multiple countries and cultures within a complex, matrixed, highly regulated industry Exceptional executive advisory skills with the confidence and judgment to influence C-suite leaders Evidence-led communication planning using reputation research, analytics and measurement frameworks Proven excellence in narrative development and high-impact content creation across digital, social and in-person channels Strength in issues and crisis communications, including scenario planning and rapid-response protocols Track record of brand stewardship and localization that balances global consistency with market relevance Experience partnering with Corporate Affairs, Public Affairs, Medical, Commercial and HR to drive integrated outcomes Familiarity with sustainability and ESG storytelling, and its relevance to corporate reputation Multilingual capability and willingness to travel when required Here you will shape how a global business communicates during a period of rapid growth and digital evolution, with unexpected teams in the same room unleashing bold thinking to move faster and smarter for patients. You will work with cutting-edge tools, from analytics that clarify where to focus to automated workflows that scale best practice, while partnering with leaders who value kindness alongside ambition. Your ideas will translate into real outcomes—clearer decisions, stronger reputation, more engaged colleagues and, ultimately, better, quicker solutions reaching patients—supported by a collaborative network that shares, learns and delivers together. Step forward to set the narrative for millions of patients and thousands of colleagues—lead International communications with impact and make your mark from day one! Job Title: Senior Frontend Engineer Location: Gaithersburg, MD At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person. Recognizing the importance of individualized flexibility, our ways of working allow employees to balance personal and work commitments while ensuring we continue to create a strong culture of collaboration and teamwork by engaging face-to-face in our offices 3 days a week . Our head office is purposely designed with collaboration in mind, providing space where teams can come together to strategize, brainstorm and connect on key projects. Are you ready to be part of the future of healthcare? Can you think big, be bold, and harness the power of digital and AI to tackle longstanding life sciences challenges? Then Evinova, a global health tech business might be for you! Transform patients’ lives through technology, data, and innovative ways of working. You’re disruptive, decisive, and transformative. Someone excited to use technology to improve patients’ health. We’re building a new Health-tech business – Evinova, a fully-owned subsidiary of AstraZeneca Group. Evinova delivers market-leading digital health solutions that are science-based, evidence-led, and human experience-driven. Thoughtful risks and quick decisions come together to accelerate innovation across the life sciences sector. Be part of a diverse team that pushes the boundaries of science by digitally empowering a deeper understanding of the patients we’re helping. Launch pioneering digital solutions that improve the patients’ experience and deliver better health outcomes. Together, we have the opportunity to combine deep scientific expertise with digital and artificial intelligence to serve the wider healthcare community and create new standards across the sector. Introduction to Role: Evinova is currently looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer to join our Product Engineering team. This role requires someone that codes daily, is self-motivated, and has a passion for development. We’ll rely on you to bring your technical acumen to help the team continue to deliver world class solutions. In this role, you will be a Senior Frontend Engineer in our product – Study Designer. Study Designer empowers clinical teams to design, optimize and automate authoring and downstream systems. It combines AI with deep expertise to accelerate timelines, enhance site and patient experiences, and unlock significant cost savings. This role will be based in Gaithersburg, US and you will be a part of our global product engineering team. Our team is a high performing team in a fast-paced environment, and you will often be working with team members across multiple locations. You will be collaborating with cross functional teams – like design, product, and platform. You will be given requirements that you are expected to understand, plan, develop, and thoroughly test before considering the work completed. Deployments are also handled by our team, and you will need to be capable of deploying your code. You are expected to thoroughly understand the Software Development Lifecycle and best practices that should allow you to help your fellow teammates, deliver/deploy the product, and escalate appropriately to your lead. You will also be coordinating with different teams as needed for integrations. Accountabilities: Frontend Development: Utilize your deep understanding of JavaScript fundamentals, including data types, function scoping, DOM scripting, debugging, async operations, events, and network requests, to build robust and scalable frontend applications. TypeScript Proficiency: Define types and configurations to ensure type safety and maintainability in our codebase. React Expertise: Develop and maintain components using React, leveraging hooks, state management, and lazy loading techniques to optimize performance. Build Tools: Employ Webpack and/or Vite to streamline the build process and enhance development efficiency. Testing: Implement and maintain test frameworks to ensure code quality and reliability. Styling: Apply CSS and SASS, including CSS in JS, selectors, and cascading fundamentals, to create visually appealing and responsive designs. Collaboration: Work closely with design teams to translate designs into functional code, ensuring a seamless user experience. Visualization: Integrate visualization libraries to present data in an intuitive and interactive manner. Essential Skills/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, Electrical Engineering, Math, Computer Science, Information Science, or equivalent level of experience is preferred. 5+ years of hands-on experience in frontend development. Long history of enjoying problem solving and building things JavaScript Fundamentals: Data types, function scoping, DOM scripting, debugging, async operations, events, and network requests. TypeScript: Defining types and configurations. React: Hooks, components, state management, and lazy loading. Build Tools: Webpack and/or Vite. Testing Frameworks: Experience with test frameworks. CSS and SASS: CSS in JS, selectors, and cascading fundamentals. Design Collaboration: Experience working with design teams and translating designs to code. Visualization Libraries: Experience with visualization libraries. Desirable Skills/Experience: Additional JavaScript Frameworks: Experience with Angular, Vue, etc. React Libraries: Familiarity with Tanstack, NextJs, and MUI or other popular component libraries. AI‑Enhanced Development Tooling : Experience using AI coding assistants such as Cursor, GitHub Copilot, Claude Code, Devin, or similar tools. Ability to incorporate AI into the development workflow for documentation, code generation, refactoring, and testing. Where can I find out more? Evinova is a global health tech business, separate company part of the AstraZeneca group. Together, we can accelerate the delivery of life-changing medicines, improve the design and delivery of clinical trials for better patient experiences and outcomes, and think more holistically about patient care before, during, and after treatment. We know that regulators, healthcare professionals, and care teams at clinical trial sites do not want a fragmented approach. They do not want a future where every pharmaceutical company provides its own, different digital solutions. They want solutions that work across the sector, simplify their workload, and benefit patients broadly. By bringing our solutions to the wider life sciences community, we can help build more unified approaches to how we all develop and deploy digital technologies, better serving our teams, physicians, and ultimately patients. Evinova represents a unique opportunity to deliver meaningful outcomes with digital and AI to serve the wider healthcare community and create new standards for the sector. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of health tech business to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting-edge methods, and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer (Focus on Frontend) - Evinova

description.text: Job Title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer (Focus on Frontend) Location: Gaithersburg, MD At AstraZeneca, we pride ourselves on crafting a collaborative culture that champions knowledge-sharing, ambitious thinking and innovation – ultimately providing employees with the opportunity to work across teams, functions and even the globe. Recognizing the importance of individualized flexibility, our ways of working allow employees to balance personal and work commitments while ensuring we continue to create a strong culture of collaboration and teamwork by engaging face-to-face in our offices 3 days a week . Our head is purposely designed with collaboration in mind, providing space where teams can come together to strategize, brainstorm and connect on key projects. Are you ready to be part of the future of healthcare? Can you think big, be bold, and harness the power of digital and AI to tackle longstanding life sciences challenges? Then Evinova, a global health tech business might be for you! Transform patients’ lives through technology, data, and innovative ways of working. You’re disruptive, decisive, and transformative. Someone excited to use technology to improve patients’ health. We’re building a new Health-tech business – Evinova, a fully-owned subsidiary of AstraZeneca Group. Evinova delivers market-leading digital health solutions that are science-based, evidence-led, and human experience-driven. Thoughtful risks and quick decisions come together to accelerate innovation across the life sciences sector. Be part of a diverse team that pushes the boundaries of science by digitally empowering a deeper understanding of the patients we’re helping. Launch pioneering digital solutions that improve the patients’ experience and deliver better health outcomes. Introduction to Role: At Evinova, we’re revolutionizing clinical trials by developing cutting-edge digital solutions that connect patients, healthcare professionals, and regulators. As part of the AstraZeneca Group, our mission is to simplify participation in clinical trials and improve health outcomes through innovative technology. We believe in creating meaningful software that empowers individuals and transforms lives. If you’re passionate about building scalable, high-quality backend systems and working in a collaborative environment, we’d love for you to join our team. As a Software Engineer within a full-stack team, you’ll be an essential part of a cross-functional team, working with a focus on frontend UI development that provides the best experience for patients and healthcare professionals alike, and you’ll be required, when relevant, to provide full stack expertise for backend development as well. You’ll collaborate with product owners, UI designers and backend developers to efficiently create a robust UI experience and to support a product that must adhere to regulations during the development process to allow usage of the product as part of clinical trials. Accountabilities: Building and maintaining functionality for our web, as well as mobile, applications. Making sure the design and implementation are robust, responsive and providing a high performance experience of the user interface, while contributing to the system’s architecture. Working with our DevOps and Platform teams to ensure an easy deployment of new UI features. Collaborating with other engineers, product owners, and stakeholders to refine features and ensure the requirements are delivered as requested. Writing high-quality, clean, maintainable, and testable code, with a strong focus on a test automation-first attitude. Solving, diagnosing, and resolving bugs and performance issues, and analyzing them to improve the troubleshooting process. Participating in Agile ceremonies, such as daily stand-ups and sprint planning. Essential Skills/Experience: 6+ years of professional experience in software development. Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field or equivalent experience. Proficiency with frontend coding languages such as typescript and/or React/React Native. Proficiency with HTTP, HTML, CSS, REST APIs and JSON structure, openAPI spec. Proficiency with at least one backend coding language such as Java, node.js, etc. including building RESTful APIs and microservices. Experience with unit tests, and BDD testing framework like Cucumber. AWS tooling. Experience with CI/CD tools, such as Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions. Familiarity with containerization tools and orchestration like Docker and Kubernetes. Strong understanding of software development principles, such as object-oriented programming and Agile methodologies. Desirable Skills/Experience: Advantageous: Experience in the past year incorporating generative AI tools in a work-related, or personal, project. Experience in implementing UI using Micro Frontends. Experience designing solutions for complex projects within large organizations. Knowledge of state management libraries like Redux . Where can I find out more? title: Senior Manager – R&D, GBS Process and Analytics Services

description.text: Job Title: Senior Manager – R&D, GBS Process and Analytics Services GCL : E Introduction to role: Are you ready to turn sophisticated R&D processes into engines of measurable value and faster science? Can you see yourself building sponsor-level relationships and leading agile delivery Pods that unlock efficiency, reduce risk, and generate insights at scale? This role is central to how we modernize and streamline the enterprise. You will drive high-impact workflow improvement and data analysis across R&D, introducing smarter ways of working through automation and data-driven decisions. Your work will free time for discovery, accelerate outcomes, and directly influence how quickly we bring life-changing medicines to patients. You will join a collaborative, fast-moving community focused on practical impact. Here, critical thinking meets decisive delivery. You will develop roadmaps, gain agreement, and lead cross-functional teams. This will drive tangible outcomes and set the pace for our next growth chapter. Accountabilities: Collaborator Sponsorship: Forge and cultivate trusted relationships with senior business collaborators and capability leaders, converting them into sponsors to drive long-term value realization. Opportunity Portfolio: Partner with business unit leaders to identify and evaluate high-potential process transformation, analytics, and insights opportunities (greater than $1m per annum) that deliver efficiency, productivity gains, cost reductions, or risk mitigation. Delivery Pods Leadership: Establish, lead, and be accountable for delivery Pods aligned to business units, providing end-to-end services through defined roles and operating models, with impact demonstrated by business value delivered and adherence to timelines. Cross-Functional Planning: Collaborate with technical capability (service line) leads, other towers, and IT to plan transformation initiatives, handle delivery capacity, and ensure timely completion of Pod objectives. Pipeline Development: Drive the identification and development of new comprehensive process improvement and analytics opportunities within the assigned business domain. Principles Integration: Ensure principles and strategic ambitions are integrated into business units in collaboration with other towers. Performance Outcomes: Achieve functional objectives across led business units, including recharges, NPS, financial savings, hours saved, and productivity metrics. Expectation Management: Lead senior collaborator expectations against agreed business outcomes and delivery roadmaps. Roadmap Co-Creation: Co-develop and lead all aspects of customer-aligned roadmaps for large-scale, cross-functional, end-to-end process improvement projects. Scope and Value Assessment: Evaluate project scopes, assess business value relative to cost, and develop supporting cases. Deal-to-Delivery Transition: Be responsible for the preparation of project charters, funding agreements, and related documentation to ensure seamless transitions from sales to solution delivery. Agile POD Structuring: Structure cross-functional, agile POD teams to identify, assess, scope, and implement process optimization initiatives, guiding teams toward targeted value realization. Business Case and ROI: Develop and communicate data-driven reasons and ROI models to explain initiatives to senior leadership, securing agreement and internal funding. Culture and Talent: Uphold AstraZeneca values, fostering activities that attract, develop, and retain top talent, ensuring consistent delivery of services that exceed customer expectations. Serve as an active member of the functional team crafting R&D efforts. Help develop the overall strategy for process improvement and data analysis services. Essential Skills/Experience: Shown professional services and consultative sales experience, with a strong history of success in strategic business partnering, relationship management, and new business development Strong eye for business combined with the ability to establish, grow, and maintain trusted relationships with senior business collaborators and capability leaders, focussed on long-term value creation Shown experience in defining portfolio strategy, collaborator engagement, relationship management, business planning, well-experienced in scaling portfolio Create tailored engagement strategies, robust frameworks to prioritise value creation opportunities, and high-level benefits targets based on the customer’s strategic objectives and business process insights A consistent track record of delivering end-to-end process optimisation initiatives (>$1m) across a large-scale global business / portfolio Strong leadership skills with line management experience (global line management experience strongly preferred). Solid understanding across multiple technology driven process transformation and analytics capabilities (Process Mining, Process Re-Engineering, Robotics Process Automation, BPM, Power BI, Power Apps, Data science and others) both internal to Process and Analytics Services and externally across GBS, IT and wider AZ Exceptional influencing skills across all collaborator levels including development of compelling Business Cases Experience in leading highly sophisticated, cross-functional projects/programs in a matrixed model Experience in collaborating and working with high-performing, globally based teams Desirable Proven background in a fast-paced Global Business Services environment with minimal oversight Understanding of R&D biopharmaceutical processes Familiarity with the biopharmaceuticals industry Active engagement in technology industry trends supporting process improvement Experience or qualifications in a related technology area Experience working with Agile delivery methodology Experience of working globally with multi-cultural awareness and cultural adaptability When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash ambitious thinking with the power to encourage life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That's why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we're not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our outstanding and daring world. Why AstraZeneca: You will be part of a global, relationship-driven community that blends strategic thinking with decisive delivery, using automation, analytics, and smart operating models to reshape how we work and accelerate impact for patients. We value kindness alongside ambition, pairing rigorous problem-solving with a culture of learning, coaching, and two-way feedback. Here, unexpected teams come together to challenge the norm, move quickly, and share knowledge, giving you the platform to influence the enterprise—freeing scientists to focus on discovery, elevating efficiency across functions, and building a career defined by meaningful outcomes. Call to Action: Seize this opportunity to lead high-impact Pods and turn complex R&D challenges into measurable value—bring your expertise and make your mark today! Date Posted 09-Feb-2026 Closing Date 16-Feb-2026 AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements.

Location: Hamilton, Ontario Onsite 5 days a week Fusion Pharmaceuticals, a member of the AstraZeneca Group, is a clinical-stage oncology company focused on developing next-generation radioconjugates (RCs) as precision medicines. Fusion connects alpha particle emitting isotopes to various targeting molecules to selectively deliver the alpha emitting payloads to tumors. Fusion’s clinical portfolio includes: FPI-2265 targeting prostate specific membrane antigen (PSMA) for metastatic castration resistant prostate cancer currently in a Phase 2 trial; FPI-1434 targeting insulin-like growth factor 1 receptor currently in a Phase 1 trial; FPI-2059, a small molecule targeting neurotensin receptor 1 (NTSR1), currently in a Phase 1 trial; and FPI-2068, a bispecific IgG-based EGFR-cMET targeted radioconjugate currently in a Phase 1 trial. In addition, Fusion is pursuing combination programs between RCs and DNA Damage Response Inhibitors (DDRis) and immune-oncology agents. Fusion has a fully operational Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) compliant state-of-the-art radiopharmaceutical manufacturing facility to meet supply demand for Fusion's growing pipeline of RCs. As the Senior Manager, External Manufacturing reporting into the Director, External Radiopharmaceutical Manufacturing Operations you will be responsible for supporting external manufacturing projects. This individual will facilitate scheduling meetings, follow up on project tasks, and track progress against key project milestones and KPI’s. This position is located onsite in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada. Responsibilities and job tasks will include: Collaborating with Contract Development Manufacturing Organizations (CDMOs), the internal manufacturing site, and Clinical Supply Chain team to ensure clinical drug supply is delivered on time. Working with internal stakeholders to plan new material introduction activities within the master manufacturing schedule and providing regular updates on ongoing activities and project statuses. Lead cross-functional planning and execution of tech transfer, scale-up, process characterization, and validation (PPQ/PV). Ensure equipment/facility readiness, comparability, and robust control strategies. Partner with QA to ensure GMP compliance, inspection readiness, data integrity, and robust deviation/CAPA and change control. Support internal and external audits and regulatory inspections. Assisting in outlining and drafting Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Work Instructions for departmental activities. Build collaborative, performance-driven partnerships, resolve escalations, and influence senior leaders internally and at CDMOs to align on roadmaps and improvements. Manage budgets, POs, and cost models. Negotiate pricing and terms, track cost-to-serve, and deliver productivity initiatives without compromising quality or supply reliability. Performing other duties as required by the business. Qualifications: A BSc/MSc in Chemistry, engineering, or health sciences 5+ years of experience in manufacturing, supply chain management, or project management within the pharmaceutical or radiopharmaceutical industry. Strong organizational skills with a proven ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders. Experience with CDMOs and familiarity with external manufacturing processes is highly desirable. Knowledge of GMP regulations and clinical drug supply processes is a strong asset. Detail-oriented with a proactive approach to problem-solving. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary team environment. Willingness to take on new tasks and responsibilities as required. Fusion Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, if contacted for an interview, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. At AstraZeneca Canada, we are committed to fostering a collaborative environment where innovation and ambitious thinking drive our success. Performance frameworks : Establish and refine KPIs and performance measurement, turning signals into actions through monthly outlooks, risks/opportunities, and executive‑ready narratives. Talent development : Mentor and elevate forecasting and performance talent; foster an inclusive, curious, and accountable team culture. Experience: Minimum 5 years’ experience in forecasting, analytics, or finance (preferably in the pharmaceutical industry), with demonstrated impact in strategic analysis and team leadership. Strategic and Analytical Skills: Exceptional ability to analyze complex data, identify strategic insights, and communicate recommendations to senior leadership. Leadership: Proven leadership skills with experience in managing impactful teams. Strong capability in mentoring, developing talent, and fostering an inclusive and collaborative team environment. Communication Skills: Outstanding communication skills, with the ability to simplify sophisticated information for a variety of audiences. Critical Thinking and Planning: Advanced critical thinking and planning skills, with a keen ability to challenge the status quo and drive innovative solutions. Desirable Skills/Experience Oncology impact : Strategic leadership influencing patient outcomes and commercial success in Oncology. Integrated insights exposure : Experience spanning forecasting, analytics, and best practices from global teams and alliances. Technology enablement : Passion for championing new tools and AI, driving capacity building in the OBU . Growth environment : Thrives in a vibrant, supportive culture with extensive learning, wellness resources, and cross‑functional events. title: Senior Pharmaceutical Sales Specialist, Advanced Specialty Care ATTR - Los Angeles (North), CA

description.text: At AstraZeneca we turn ideas into life-changing medicines. Working here means thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We’re focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we think we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. At AstraZeneca, we are taking bold action on climate because we recognize the connection between healthy people and a healthy planet. As part of our flagship Ambition Zero Carbon program, we have committed to a fully electric vehicle (EV) fleet, which means that all of our drivers will be assigned an EV. As a Senior Pharmaceutical Sales Specialist for the Advanced Specialty Team ATTR, you’ll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients’ lives! Duties and Responsibilities Develops and demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of complex clinical disease states and advanced treatment guidelines. Clearly communicates complex product information to healthcare professionals to positively impact patient outcomes. Analyzes market trends and develops strategic business plans that leverage a deep understanding of the market landscape, dynamics and patient access challenges. Addressing customer needs and driving sales performance. • Provides solutions to customer by creating tailored experiences that address the unique needs of each account. Collaborates effectively across sales teams and cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of strategies and comprehensive management of key accounts. Identifies opportunities for process improvement, demonstrates a growth mindset and seeks innovative approaches to sales and customer engagement. Essential Skills / Experience Bachelor’s degree 8+ yrs of demonstrated Sales or Commercial experience or a combination of pharmaceutical, healthcare, scientific, clinical, institutional, or related industry / settings within the healthcare ecosystem Experience in account planning and/or complex reimbursement model A valid driver’s license and safe driving record ​ Essential Capabilities Advanced Therapeutic Area Expertise: Experience and expertise in highly specialized therapeutic areas Clinical Acumen: Exceptional ability to understand and communicate cutting-edge scientific research and clinical data. Business Acumen: Proficiency in advanced data analysis and the use of analytics to drive sales performance. Customer Engagement: Proven ability to engage with senior-level healthcare professionals, including specialists and hospital administrators. Growth & Innovation Mindset: Experience in developing and implementing innovative sales strategies in a highly specialized market. Strategic Partnerships: Experience in establishing and nurturing strategic partnerships with healthcare institutions and research organizations. Preference for the candidate to be based in Los Angeles or surrounding cities including Pasadena, Duarte, Bakersfield, Thousand Oaks etc. Please note - Relocation assistance is not available for this position. Why AstraZeneca? At AstraZeneca, we are on a journey to bring life-saving medicines to patients. Our role in contributing to decreasing mortality rates globally is clear. We shape the future by spotting scientifically led commercial opportunities and acting now to operationalize and scale them. Driven by the solutions we bring to the healthcare ecosystem, we make an impact at every step of the patient journey, improving their experience and outcomes. Our agile and entrepreneurial team of visionaries is trusted to innovate and experiment, supported to learn fast from failures and move on. Join us in making a difference – apply today! title: Senior Scientist – Antibody Deep Screening Platform

description.text: Location: Gaithersburg, MD Type: Onsite Are You Wired to Build the Future of Biologics Discovery? We’re looking for a scientific tinkerer, a platform builder, a fearless innovator. If you thrive on designing elegant experiments, love pushing the boundaries of science, and bounce back stronger from failure, this is your playground. At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. About the Role Join the Discovery Innovation Team within Biologics Engineering—a multidisciplinary group that invents and implements novel approaches for biologics discovery. Your role will be to advance a deep screening technology that fuses next-generation sequencing with ribosome display to discover and optimize antibodies. This is not a routine role – it will involve careful design, prototyping and testing where you will need to fail fast and learn faster, ultimately bringing forward a technology to deploy in therapeutic programs What You’ll Do Optimize wet lab components for in-vitro transcription/translation, ribosome display, and antibody screening. Construct NGS libraries for Illumina platforms, then work with our NGS core to build workflows to enable parallel antibody screening and sequencing Run enrichment campaigns using phage or yeast display with diverse libraries (naïve, synthetic, immune). Present findings to cross-functional teams with clarity and conviction. Qualifications Ph.D. in molecular biology or related field M.S. with 5+ years’ experience B.S. with 10+ years’ experience Required Skills: Proven track record in antibody discovery using display-based in-vitro systems , from library generation to panning and screening of monoclonal binders. Strong experimental design skills with a bias toward rapid iteration and outcome-driven workflows. Hands-on, end-to-end experience with library sequencing on NGS platforms. Excellent communication and data presentation skills. Desired Skills: Tissue culture and functional cell-based assay development. Fluorescence microscopy and image analysis. Computational fluency in NGS data analysis, including AI-based approaches. About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD: Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility creates life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus is the home of R&D in the US and employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. Here, we play host to some of the most cutting-edge technology and lab spaces, all designed to inspire collaboration and cross-functional science. We believe employees benefit from being challenged and inspired at work. We are dedicated to creating a culture of inclusion and collaboration. The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost productivity and help keep our employees stay happy and healthy. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while increasing collaboration between teams. The annual base pay for this position ranges from $ 116,284.00 - $174,426.00 . Hourly and salaried non-exempt employees will also be paid overtime pay when working qualifying overtime hours. Base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. In addition, our positions offer a short-term incentive bonus opportunity; eligibility to participate in our equity-based long-term incentive program (salaried roles), to receive a retirement contribution (hourly roles), and commission payment eligibility (sales roles). Benefits offered included a qualified retirement program [401(k) plan]; paid vacation and holidays; paid leaves; and, health benefits including medical, prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans. title: Senior Scientist – Early Product Development and Manufacturing

description.text: Title: Senior Scientist – Early Product Development and Manufacturing Location: Macclesfield or Cambridge - UK Salary: Competitive AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-centred biopharmaceutical company focusing on discovering, developing, and commercialising prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than a global leading pharma company. At AstraZeneca, we're dedicated to being a Great Place to Work and empowering employees to push the boundaries of science and fuel their entrepreneurial spirit. Pharmaceutical Sciences is a department within AstraZeneca R&D unit. The vision for Pharmaceutical Sciences is to deliver the therapies of the future through scientific leadership in drug delivery, design of synthetic routes and manufacturing of Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API) and drug product. Our portfolio of projects includes traditional small molecules, nucleotide-based therapies and nanomedicines across AstraZeneca’s therapy areas. An opportunity exists in Pharmaceutical Sciences for an exceptional individual in the area of solid-state chemistry, working across drug substance and drug product disciplines. We are looking for an enthusiastic and highly capable Senior Scientist to join our Early Product Development and Manufacturing (EPDM) team in the UK. You will work closely with analytical, formulation and biopharmaceutics scientists in EPDM as well as scientists in other functions to drive science and innovation within drug projects, including global collaboration with scientists at our Macclesfield, Cambridge, Boston & Gothenburg sites. The successful applicant will become a core member of the global Solid-state skill area which is responsible for ensuring suitable physical form and formulation screening, selection and control within drug substance and product. The team supports the full discovery and early development stages up to Phase II clinical trials. The successful candidate will be a self-starting, exceptional team player, committed to delivering high quality science to projects. Accountabilities: Responsible for ensuring suitable physical form and early formulation screening, physical characterisation, form and formulation selection and control within drug substance and product. Represent solid state skill area in projects. Work closely with formulation, analytical, and biopharmaceutics scientists in EPDM as well as scientists in other functions to drive science and innovation. Deliver robust physical forms which meet the needs of the patient. Plan and conduct lab-based experimental work in accordance with project timelines. Keep abreast with the scientific literature and proactively apply existing and novel approaches to projects. Drive and lead science personally and within the department, manage external collaborations and publish novel work in peer reviewed journals. This role is a lab based role and requires full time office presence with some flexibility. Essential skills: You will have a Chemistry or Pharmacy PhD or be a graduate with relevant experience in the area of solid-state chemistry, formulation, physical chemistry or related disciplines. You will have experience in the screening and characterisation of solids (e.g. X-ray diffraction, spectroscopy, thermal analysis, microscopic techniques, moisture sorption etc.), a good awareness of analytical methodology and an enthusiasm for laboratory-based work. You will have experience of or a keen interest in small scale, high throughput automation for screening of solid forms/formulations. Creativity and innovation, built on sound technical knowledge and problem-solving skills are required in order to deliver robust physical forms which meet the needs of the patient. Assess, review and report data from own work, with a clear understanding of its reliability and interpret findings and draws authoritative conclusions and recommendations so that their significance can be appreciated. Present information for discussion in multi-disciplinary project teams. Excellent communication, team working, networking and leadership skills. Work as a member of cross-functional teams, with a large degree of independence representing own department or area of expertise. Desirable skills: Experience/knowledge or a keen interest in the field of modelling, simulation or prediction would be advantageous. Ability to drive and lead science personally and within the department and manage external collaborations. Knowledge or a keen interest in the area of automation would be advantageous. Computational skills e.g. python programming will be advantageous, especially in the areas of automated image analysis. Understanding of the principles and concepts of crystallisation. Experience in amorphous materials and their characterisation will be advantageous as would experience in examination of crystal structures and use of relevant software tools e.g. tools such as Mercury, Materials Studio etc. In depth understanding of how the physicochemical and solid-state properties of a drug, effect the manufacture, formulatability and in vitro and in vivo performance. Understanding of the use, application and interpretation of Solid State NMR So, what’s next? We welcome your application no later than 20th February 2026 Where can I find out more? Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/ Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en Are you ready to make a difference? Apply today and join us in our mission to improve global public health! AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law.
