Die Position At Roche, our Global Product Development Safety & Risk Management (PDS) department aims to enhance healthcare for patients by elucidating and communicating the safety profile of Roche medicines to optimize their benefit-risk profile. We are seeking an experienced PV systems expert to lead a global sub-function. The Opportunity The Group Director leads the Pharmacovigilance Intelligent Automation and Business Systems Solutions (PVIS) sub-function, taking full business ownership of the technologies that enable global PV and safety compliance activities. This role is responsible for evaluating, implementing, and sustaining the business systems-related activities that are critical to our PV/safety processes throughout the product lifecycle. By assessing changing internal needs and the evolving external landscape, the Group Director ensures that the sub-function manages a systems solutions portfolio that remains validated, compliant and can drive continually improving business effectiveness and efficiency. As a member of the functional leadership team within the PV & Scientific Development function, the Group Director leads a global group across 3 sites. This leadership requires a deep blend of GxP safety, scientific and business operational knowledge to support their team and aligned process experts across GVP, GCP, and devices safety. The global team ensures the infrastructure is robust enough to manage business critical activities, including exchange of individual case safety reports (ICSRs) and the provision of data for compliance oversight. Beyond managing existing systems, the Group Director is a catalyst for business innovation. They are expected to anticipate new technological developments including process automation and opportunities to further apply artificial intelligence, in order to improve effectiveness. Success depends on building close collaborative relationships with the wider safety community, with Roche IT teams, and other internal functions to provide expert guidance on PV and safety systems and data reporting. Externally, the Group Director will aim to be recognised as an industry thought leader, representing the company in collaborations with health authorities and industry associations. They also manage relationships with vendors and service providers to ensure ongoing support and innovation. Central to this role is the ability to inspire and empower a senior global team, fostering a culture of continuous learning/improvement and high performance while contributing to the overarching strategic direction of PDS. Who you are You offer a relevant degree-level qualification and 10+ years of extensive experience in the PV and clinical safety-related data, systems and reporting area. With the ability to span across Pharmacovigilance (PV) and wider science/technology disciplines (Data/Computer Science). Evidence of extensive practical application is essential. You bring at least 5 years of people leadership experience, with a track record of leading teams to deliver complex, cross-functional projects of high business importance/risk. You possess expert-level knowledge of the entire technology lifecycle from ideation and design to implementation, specifically for complex solutions that drive compliance, scientific evidence generation, AI-application and/or operational improvements. You have gained essential, hands-on experience in a safety function, mastering the collection, processing, and reporting of PV data within the context of complex regulatory legislation. You demonstrate advanced strategic and analytical thinking, allowing you to synthesize complex information to inform decisions and create effective business proposals even when faced with significant ambiguity. You maintain highly developed communication and influencing skills, enabling you to build successful collaborations across global business units and drive decisions. Location & Travel Requirements This position must be based in either Basel, Switzerland or Welwyn Garden City in The United Kingdom. Although this can be a hybrid role, with an expectation of ongoing and sustained site presence, in compliance with local company requirements. International business travel may be required. Typically this will be required around 10% of the time, depending upon the site location of the jobholder and/or the requirements of the role for ongoing leadership or business project-related activities. Where pay transparency applies, details are provided based on the primary posting location. For this role, the primary location is Basel. If you are interested in the additional location where this role may be based, we will provide the relevant compensation details later in the hiring process. title: Head of RDT Pharma Technical Operations

description.text: Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Die Position The position will report to the Global Head Digital Technology - Pharma Medicines which is still being recruited About Roche Digital Technology (RDT) Roche Digital Technology (RDT) is where innovation meets purpose. As a global team at the heart of Roche, we are a community of business-minded technologists committed to help shape tomorrow’s digital future of healthcare. Our mission is to power Roche through cutting-edge digital technologies, harnessing the potential of artificial intelligence, data, and scalable tech innovations. Driven by purpose and passion, we’re building a future where digital is a core strength across all of Roche, enabling smarter ways of working, unlocking human potential, and driving breakthroughs that truly matter for millions of patients around the world. Role Summary As the Head of RDT for Pharma Technical Operations (PT) , you assume a critical executive leadership role, serving as the essential Strategic Business Partner to the Global Head of Pharma Technical Operations and their Leadership Team. This position is accountable for the performance and results of a vital division within the Sub-Function, directly influencing and shaping the overall PT digital strategy . Your strategic mandate is to co-create, define, and drive the unified global digital strategy covering all capabilities required to run a world-leading Pharma Manufacturing & Supply Chain organization. This encompasses Drug Substance, Drug Product, GMP Quality, Supply Chain, and the crucial convergence of Information Technology (IT) and Operational Technology (OT) to build a truly integrated and resilient global production network. You are directly responsible for delivering a compliant digital landscape that ensures uninterrupted production and uncompromising operational excellence , translating complex business imperatives into robust, forward-looking technology solutions that drive competitive advantage. Key Accountabilities The Head of RDT will provide leadership and direction through multiple levels of management, executing the long-term operational strategy to achieve key business objectives: Global Digitalization Strategy: Define and execute the comprehensive digital strategy for manufacturing, supply chain, and logistics. This includes the accelerated digitalization of factories, the deployment of smart logistics solutions, and the modernization of our quality and control systems. Operational Resilience and Assurance: Ensure uninterrupted production and resilient service delivery with an extremely low tolerance for failure. Establish a proactive monitoring framework and a robust incident response plan to ensure all mission-critical systems—from shop-floor automation to enterprise-level planning—maintain continuous operation. Asset and Efficiency Optimization: Spearhead continuous, integrated enhancements to the digital landscape, identifying and implementing solutions that significantly enhance operational efficiency and physical asset management. This utilizes technologies such as the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT), AI-powered predictive maintenance, and digital twins to optimize performance and reduce downtime. Strategic Executive Partnership: Function as a strategic partner to senior leaders across manufacturing and supply chain, actively participating in business steering committees to influence sub-function strategy. Manage a global portfolio of projects that are directly tied to critical business outcomes. Product and Portfolio Governance: Own the overall product vision, strategy, and roadmap for all platforms managed within the domain. Lead a group of Product Managers and Engineering Team Leads, ensuring the continuous improvement, robust operation, and high-quality delivery of the product suite. Enterprise Integration: Work seamlessly with the ERP Centre of Excellence (CoE) to ensure that all manufacturing and supply chain requirements related to ERP systems are fully understood, appropriately prioritized, and delivered from the ERP CoE. Domain Financial and Operational Health: Oversee the financial, contractual, and operational health of the domain as a business unit. Provide the executive operational insight necessary to enable Product and Engineering leaders to focus on their core responsibilities of strategy and execution. Strategically manage the global budget and rigorously oversee portfolio performance. Talent and Vendor Strategy: Lead and develop a team of senior leaders, cultivating a culture of innovation and high performance. Be accountable for building strategic relationships with external vendors and technology partners to ensure the organization remains at the forefront of industry trends and capabilities. Key Leadership Competencies and skills Success in this leadership role requires a sophisticated combination of strategic insight, deep functional expertise, and proven capacity to shape strategy and lead through multiple levels of management. Domain Expertise: Possesses a deep understanding of pharmaceutical manufacturing, supply chain processes, and related technologies (e.g., MES, ERP, IoT). Extensive experience with GxP regulations and the unique challenges of a highly regulated, large-scale production environment is mandatory. Operational Excellence: Demonstrated track record of successfully leading and managing mission-critical systems and processes in a production environment. Must demonstrate a "first time right" mentality and an uncompromising commitment to quality and service. Strategic & Data Acumen: Advanced ability to leverage data and analytics to optimize manufacturing workflows and inform strategic decisions. Demonstrated capability to build a compelling business case for digital investments and rigorously measure their Return on Investment (ROI). Leadership & Talent: Proven ability to lead and influence senior leaders , empowering a global team, emphasizing accountability and talent management. Must foster a culture defined by psychological safety and a strong sense of ownership. Technical Architecture Leadership: Serves as the senior technical leader across platform teams, ensuring architectural coherence, driving major cross-domain technical initiatives, and providing technical mentorship to senior engineering staff, particularly concerning IT/OT convergence. Risk & Compliance Mastery: Possesses a sophisticated and in-depth understanding of global regulatory standards (e.g., GMP) related to pharmaceutical production. Will serve as the executive point of authority for digital audit integrity, ensuring all systems are designed and operated in full compliance with global regulations. description.text: Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt. Die Position "Synthetic Molecules Technical Development" (PTDC) (temporär) vereint eine breite Palette von Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Drug Substance (DS), Drug Product (DP), Analytical Sciences und Manufacturing Science & Technology. Wir arbeiten eng mit unseren Partnern in der Forschung und globalen technischen Entwicklung zusammen. PTDC ist verantwortlich für die technische Entwicklung unserer Pipeline, die Herstellung von DS und DP für klinische Studien sowie die kommerzielle DS-Herstellung in unserem Fertigungsnetzwerk. In PTDC werden aus synthetischen Molekülen Medikamente – dabei entwickeln wir robuste, kosteneffiziente Herstellungsprozesse und schaffen Wissen durch Innovation. Das Team Plant Support & Compliance (PTDC-T) ist für die Infrastruktur, Kalibrierung, operative Sicherheit und technische Projekte in den Bereichen DS und DP zuständig. Ihre Rolle ist von entscheidender Bedeutung für den reibungslosen Betrieb sowie die Einhaltung der Compliance in der Herstellung und Entwicklung synthetischer Moleküle, wobei Sie unseren Partnern eine qualitativ hochwertige Dienstleistung nach cGMP-Richtlinien bieten. Die Möglichkeit Als Infrastruktur Mitarbeiter sind Sie für folgende Aufgaben verantwortlich: Sie betreiben und betreuen kritische Infrastrukturanlagen und Facilities, einschließlich Medien, Energien, Abluft- und Notkühlsysteme sowie die Lösungsmittelverteilung. Sie sind für die Sicherstellung des qualifizierten Status aller GMP-Anlagen im Operations-Bereich verantwortlich und führen stellvertretend die Bemusterung der Point of use Stellen des Purified Waters durch. Sie beheben Störungen, handhaben Alarme an Infrastrukturanlagen im Rahmen der Schicht und leisten Pikettdienst. Sie sind zuständig für Bedienungs-, Wartungs- und Instandhaltungsarbeiten an Geräten und Anlagen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den entsprechenden Chapters. Sie unterstützen aktiv bei technischen Projekten, wie beispielsweise der Inbetriebnahme, und helfen bei der Überwachung von Werkstatt-Aufträgen. Sie melden Abweichungen, besondere Vorkommnisse und Beobachtungen an Ihren Vorgesetzten und führen Kontrollrundgänge durch. Die Arbeit erfolgt im Drei-Schicht-Betrieb, wobei bei Bedarf auch Unterstützung in den Bereichen operative Sicherheit und Kalibrierung sowie das fachliche Mitbetreuen von Lehrlingen erforderlich ist. Wer Sie sind Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung im technischen oder pharmazeutischen Bereich (z.B. Chemie- oder Pharmatechnologe / Chemikant / Pharmakant) und bringen mindestens fünf Jahre Erfahrung im GMP-Umfeld (Produktion und/oder Entwicklung) mit, wobei zusätzliche Erfahrungen und Ausbildungen, vorzugsweise innerhalb Synthetic Molecules, einen Pluspunkt darstellen können. Ihr fundierter technischer Hintergrund umfasst ein solides technisches Verständnis von Infrastrukturanlagen und deren Automation, ergänzt durch spezifische Erfahrungen im Infrastrukturbereich und die Gewohnheit, strikt nach cGMP-Richtlinien zu arbeiten. Sie kommunizieren sicher in Wort und Schrift auf Deutsch und besitzen idealerweise auch gute Kenntnisse der englischen Sprache. Als positiv denkende, selbständige und initiative Persönlichkeit zeichnen Sie sich durch hohe Integrität, Sozialkompetenz und Flexibilität aus. Sie sind offen für die digitale Welt und motiviert, Ihre Fähigkeiten im Bereich digitaler Systeme durch kontinuierliches Lernen stetig zu erweitern. Ihre Arbeitsweise ist ergebnisorientiert, Sie fühlen sich verantwortlich für Ihre Arbeit und haben ein starkes Interesse daran, auch scheinbar etablierte Vorgänge kontinuierlich zu hinterfragen und zu verbessern. Sie haben eine inklusive Denkweise, arbeiten gerne in einem Team und der Umgang mit Menschen macht Ihnen Spaß, wobei Sie sich selbst motivieren und stets neugierig bleiben. Die Position Die Section Planning & Logistics ist eine wichtige Schnittstelle zu dem aseptischen Herstellbereich und den anderen Sections innerhalb des Clinical Supply Centers. Planning & Logistics ist unter anderem für die Planung, Beschaffung und Bereitstellung der benötigten Materialien wie auch für das Bestandsmanagement für den Manufacturing Bereich zuständig. Auch sind in dieser Einheit das MES und Automation Team integriert, welche wichtige Support-Einheiten für das CSC Parenterals darstellen und einen 1st Level User-Support gewährleisten. Aufgrund der Schnittstellen zu den Supportbereichen, wie dem Engineering, Materials Management, Supplier Quality Management und der Qualitätssicherung, hast du zusätzlich die Möglichkeit, Einblicke in angrenzende Bereiche zu erlangen. Bei folgenden Tätigkeiten wirst du uns während deines Praktikums unterstützen: Mitwirkung bei allgemeinen Projekten und Support im täglichen Arbeitsablauf. Durchführung von Verbesserungsmaßnahmen und Unterstützung in den Fachbereichen Planung, Master Data & Material Management, Logistik , Automation und MES Support. Definition von KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) Visualisierung von Geschäftsprozessen, Erstellen von Dokumenten. Unterstützung der Section bei Projekten sowie Übernahme von Teilprojekten und Begleitung von Meetings, inklusive Tracking der Aufgaben. Wer Du Bist Das bringst du für diese Rolle mit: Du studierst aktuell Logistik Management, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder Wirtschaftsinformatik und möchtest dein Wissen nun in der Praxis einsetzen. Offenheit für neue Ideen und Freude an der Arbeit in einem leistungsorientierten Umfeld, das auf gegenseitigem Respekt und Zusammenarbeit basiert. Teamfähige, flexible und entscheidungsfreudige Persönlichkeit mit einer motivierten und selbstständigen Arbeitsweise. Hohe Affinität für IT-Applikationen sowie ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten zur Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen im E2E-Denken. Fließende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse für die tägliche Kommunikation und Zusammenarbeit in einem vielfältigen Team. ​ Bewerbungsprozess Für die Bewerbung benötigen wir eine gültige Immatrikulationsbestätigung, ein Motivationsschreiben und einen Lebenslauf. Die Position Roche Kaiseraugst ist ein Eckpfeiler im weltweiten Produktions- und Logistiknetz von Roche. Über 1900 Personen sind hier beschäftigt. Der Standort beherbergt den größten und innovativsten Verpackungsbetrieb von Roche weltweit. Durch eigenverantwortliche Zusammenarbeit in divers aufgestellten Teams verfolgen wir unsere Vision: Die bestmögliche Patientenversorgung bei geringen Kosten für die Gesellschaft! In der Manufacturing Unit Solids DP kümmern wir uns an den Produktionsstandorten in Kaiseraugst und Basel um die Herstellung und Verpackung verschiedener fester Arzneiformen. Hierzu zählen Filmtabletten, Kapseln und Granulate zur Herstellung von Oralsuspensionen. Wir bieten in der Manufacturing Unit Solids DP ein Praktikum in der Technical Asset Care Gruppe (Werkstatt) an, welches sich primär an Studierende aus dem Bereich Pharmatechnik, Maschinenbau, Life Sciences oder Ingenieurswesen richtet. Während des Praktikums unterstützt du die Technical Unit im Produktionsbetrieb Kaiseraugst. Du erlernst hierbei den Umgang und die Umsetzung der umfangreichen GMP-Regularien der pharmazeutischen Industrie. In dieser Position wirst du: Selbstständig kleinere Projekte bearbeiten (technische und verfahrenstechnische Fragestellungen). Notwendige Betriebsvorschriften und Arbeitsanweisungen (Standard Operating Procedure) im Bereich Instandhaltung, Störungsbehebung erstellen und überarbeiten. Die Optimierung unterschiedlicher Prozesse unterstützen. Arbeiten mit SAP hinsichtlich Neuanlegen, Anpassen und Löschen von Wartungsplänen und Task Listen tätigen. Fragestellungen zur Instandhaltung verschiedener Anlagen klären. Das Team bei Changes und Massnahmen (Corrective Actions) sowie bei Routinetätigkeiten unterstützen. Kontaktperson für verschiedene Schnittstellen und Ansprechpartner sein. Wer Du Bist Folgende Kompetenzen runden dein Profil ab: Du bist aktuell an einer Universität oder Fachhochschule immatrikuliert, oder du hast innerhalb von 12 Monaten vor Praktikumsbeginn deinen Abschluss gemacht, im Feld der Pharmatechnik, Maschinenbau, Life Sciences, Ingenieurwesen, Pharmamanagement & Produktion oder verwandten Richtungen. Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse sowie gute Englischkenntnisse. Ein hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative und selbstständiger Arbeitsweise sowie schnelles Auffassungsvermögen. Interesse an der konstruktiven Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Stakeholdern sowie an der Arbeit in einem dynamischen Team. Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit und Präsentationsskills. Gute IT-Kenntnisse in Office Applikationen. Zusätzliche Information Die Dauer des Praktikums liegt bei 6 - 12 Monaten und findet am Standort Kaiseraugst statt. Die Position Your department and team In Roche’s Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organization (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world’s toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed. This position is located in Molecular Characterization, a department within Large Molecule Research, where we discover and develop novel therapeutic antibodies and next generation biologics. Our ambition is to deliver such molecules to patients with game-changing clinical benefits. We are offering an opportunity for an intern (m/f/d) in the Department of Functional Characterization to work with multidisciplinary teams of associates/scientists dedicated to the in-depth characterization of complex biologics. This project based internship in the field of neurodegenerative diseases, involves the application of protein-protein interaction methods, especially surface plasmon resonance (Biacore) and ELISA. Your tasks and responsibilities Development and application of cell-free protein-protein or protein-ligand interaction methods, especially surface plasmon resonance (Biacore) and ELISA, for the functional characterization of therapeutic protein drugs. Interpretation of kinetic and affinity data and transfer of results to your supervisor. Support interdisciplinary teams within the unit of Molecule Characterization. Contribution to the establishment/adaption of new protocols. Participating in bringing new molecules to the patients. Your profile You are currently enrolled at a university, preferably in courses like Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology or you are in a gap-year between degrees (bachelor and master). You are excited about learning new techniques, data processing, evaluation, and discussing results. You are willing to perform wet lab experiments and eager to establish new techniques for studying protein-protein interactions. You are a highly motivated person, a strong team player, but capable of working independently where necessary. Good English skills (written and spoken) are necessary. Your Advantages Flexible working hours and Homeoffice Attractive recognition grant Being part of the number one diagnostic corporation Online/Offline student networking events Ability to shape and contribute the future of the organization Your Application Please upload your curriculum vitae specific to this position. Keep in mind that this internship is only directed at people who are currently enrolled at university or are in their gap year. Start 01.04.2026 or according to agreement Ideally for 6 months in Penzberg. This position is suitable for students looking for a full time internship. We are excited to see your application! Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt. Die Position Shape the Future of Medical Diagnostics: Internship in Blood Gas & Electrolyte Sensor Development Our team, «BGE Sensors & Reagents,» develops, characterizes, and optimizes various electrochemical sensors for medical devices in the field of IVD diagnostics, focusing on the measurement of blood gases, electrolytes, and metabolites in whole blood. To deliver the desired products, we select electrochemical, optical, or enzymatic measurement principles and develop the corresponding sensors. The Opportunity Dive into the world of cutting-edge sensor development with a 6-12 month internship (flexible to fit your schedule). You'll collaborate with our expert team to design, test, and optimize electrochemical sensors used in life-saving medical devices. This is your chance to apply your scientific knowledge to real-world challenges and contribute to groundbreaking advancements in healthcare. In this position, you will Collaborate with our technical experts in the development and enhancement of sensors for blood gas analysis. Contribute to sensor design investigations by planning and conducting various physical and chemical experiments and tests. You will assist in the synthesis and characterization of different functional sensor components. Help improve material stability to extend shelf life and reduce the need for complex storage by optimizing the chemical composition and synthesis processes. Support the development team with your scientific expertise and gain a deep understanding of complex electrochemical sensors and processes, including their characterization and optimization. Manage assigned work packages, plan and execute experiments, and prepare detailed analyses and documentation. You will have access to various analytical methods and tools for sensor and material analysis, as well as data analysis software to compile technical reports. Receive a comprehensive introduction to the intricate and challenging field of sensor development for globally used medical devices. Who you are We are looking for a motivated and inquisitive student or recent graduate with a background in Engineering/Science (e.g., Bachelor's/Master's degree from a Technical University), ideally in Chemistry, Material Science, Physical Chemistry, or a related field. You should have some initial experience working in a chemical laboratory environment (including organic synthesis, solution/membrane formulation, and general wet chemistry). Your graduation should be within the last 12 months. Additionally: You are eager to gain practical experience in an industrial setting and learn about development processes within a leading medical device company. You are interested in developing electrochemical sensors based on polymeric sensing layers/films, which you will help produce in the lab, measure using chemical and electrochemical methods, and analyze the resulting data. Ideally you already gained experience in a chemical laboratory environment (including organic synthesis, solution/membrane formulation, and/or general wet chemistry). You have a structured and independent approach to conducting experiments and documenting results. You are open, adaptable, and a team player. You possess strong written and verbal communication skills in English (and preferably German). Internship Details Start Date: As soon as possible in 2026 Workload: 100% Duration: Minimum 6 months (with potential for extension to 12 months) Ready to Apply? Please submit your complete application as a single PDF document, including your CV, a compelling Motivation Letter (including your desired start date and duration), a certificate of enrollment (if you are currently studying) OR Recent graduates are also eligible to start an internship with us within 12 months of their graduation date. For non-EU/EFTA citizens: Certificate from the university stating that an internship is mandatory (required due to regulations) Please note that successful applicants will be invited to an online interview as part of the recruitment process. We are looking forward to your application! Help shape the future of sustainable healthcare. Wer wir sind Eine gesündere Zukunft treibt uns zur Innovation an. Mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit arbeiten gemeinsam daran, wissenschaftliche Fortschritte zu erzielen und sicherzustellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und für zukünftige Generationen. Durch unser Engagement werden über 26 Millionen Menschen mit unseren Medikamenten behandelt und mehr als 30 Milliarden Tests mit unseren Diagnostik-Produkten durchgeführt. Wir ermutigen uns gegenseitig, neue Möglichkeiten zu erkunden, Kreativität zu fördern und hohe Ziele zu setzen, um lebensverändernde Gesundheitslösungen zu liefern. Gemeinsam können wir eine gesündere Zukunft gestalten. Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, der die Chancengleichheit fördert.

Die Position Die Abteilung QC Product Analytical Testing (PAT) ist Teil der Qualitätskontrolle an den Standorten Kaiseraugst und Basel. Sie unterstützt lokale Kunden und das globale Roche Netzwerk an den Standorten Kaiseraugst und Basel. Das Team API Raw Material, Elemental Impurities & Excipients Testing ist Teil dieser PAT Quality Unit und hat den Arbeitsort in Basel. Als Laborant:in leistest du durch präzise Analysen einen wichtigen Beitrag zur Qualitätskontrolle von Ausgangsmaterialien, Wirkstoffen und gewährleistest so die Sicherheit unserer Produkte. Die Möglichkeit: Deine Aufgaben als Laboratory Technician beinhalten insbesondere: Selbständige Durchführung und Dokumentation der chemisch-physikalischen Analytik mit unterschiedlichen analytischen Methoden gemäss den Regeln der Guten Herstellungspraxis (GMP) Review von Rohdaten GMP-gerechte Dokumentation der Ergebnisse am PC sowie Mitarbeit bei der Bearbeitung und Dokumentation von Abweichungen Betreuung und Kalibrierung von Laborgeräten Sicherstellung der Datenintegrität im eigenen Arbeitsbereich Unterstützung bei der Implementierung von LPS Methoden, 5S Konzepten und kontinuierlicher Verbesserung Wer Du Bist: Um in dieser Position erfolgreich zu sein, benötigst du folgende Kompetenzen: Ausbildung als Chemielaborant/Chemielaborantin EFZ (bevorzugt), Chemisch Technischer Assistent/in (CTA), Biologisch-Technischer Assistent/in(BTA) oder gleichwertig Erfahrung in Analytik mittels HPLC, GC, Titration, IR, UV ist eine Voraussetzung. Idealerweise haben Sie Erfahrung mit Agilent-HPLC-Systemen und der EMPOWER-Software Hands-On Erfahrung mit LIMS Systemen ist erwünscht GMP-Erfahrung im Laborumfeld erforderlich Sehr gute Teamfähigkeit, Veränderungsbereitschaft und ausgeprägtes logisches Denkvermögen und eine Affinität im Umgang mit Labor-IT-Anwendungen Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind Voraussetzung, Englischkenntnisse sind erwünscht. Diese Position ist befristet auf 2 Jahre. Bewirb dich jetzt mit deinem aktuellen Lebenslauf und releventen Zeugnissen und werde Teil unseres Teams, um gemeinsam die Zukunft zu gestalten! Die Position 1. Primary Purpose of Job (Job Summary) Roche is hiring for a greenfield facility in Shanghai and we are looking for an Operational Excellence Practitioner who is overall responsible for driving business process improvement and digital transformation within the Manufacturing department. Also provides support during the operation readiness and start-up phase to make sure readiness is executed efficiently with schedule. For this role, strong skill and experience are required to cover two areas: Capex project delivery and Routine Operation. Drive the implementation and integration of digital tools to guide smart manufacturing. Promote the concept of Operational Excellence and foster the establishment and implementation of a culture of continuous improvement. Coordinate continuous improvement, optimization projects, facilitating Operational Excellence, and adopting suitable digital tools and technology. Promote Operational Excellence Concepts and Problem-Solving Capabilities. 2. Principle Roles & Responsibilities / Accountabilities Engineering Project Support and Operation Readiness: Drive the implementation and integration of digital tools to guide the smart Manufacturing management. Promote the concept of Operational Excellence and drive the establishment of a continuous improvement culture in the new facility. Support the Manufacturing Head in executing the Operational Readiness project by acting as a coordinator to align the work of Quality, Engineering, MM, MSAT, and other departments. Ensure the project is executed in accordance with overall readiness and end-to-end (E2E) project timelines, with all departments working towards consistent goals. Perform other duties as assigned. Routine Operation: Continuous Improvement and Optimization Projects Coordinate the identification, evaluation, and selection of production processes, systems, or operational areas that require improvement and optimization. Develop detailed project plans, including objectives, scope, timelines, resource requirements, and key performance indicators (KPIs). Coordinate collaboration among cross-departmental teams (e.g., production, quality, engineering, IT, etc.) to ensure smooth project progress. Regularly monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and take timely corrective actions. Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and with high quality, and achieve expected benefits. Operational Excellence Concepts and Practices Advocate and promote the culture and methodology of Operational Excellence within the manufacturing department. Systematically eliminate waste, reduce variation, and improve process efficiency and reliability through tools and techniques such as Lean Production and Six Sigma. Organize and facilitate workshops and seminars, training team members in continuous improvement tools and skills. Digital Tools and Technologies Continuously monitor the latest digital trends and technologies in the industry. Evaluate and select digital solutions suitable for the manufacturing department's needs to improve production efficiency, data visualization, and decision-making capabilities. Lead or participate in the implementation and promotion of digital tools, ensuring their effective integration with existing systems and processes. Train and support team members in adapting to and using new digital tools, driving digital transformation. Production Processes and Improve Efficiency Deeply analyze existing production processes, identify bottlenecks, non-value-added activities, and opportunities for improvement. Design and implement optimized production processes, reduce cycle time, and increase capacity utilization. Continuously improve production efficiency through means such as process parameter optimization and equipment performance enhancement. Production Problem Solving and Root Cause Eradication Actively participate in the investigation of deviations, failures, and quality issues occurring in production. Apply systematic problem-solving tools (e.g., Fishbone Diagram, 5 Why, DMAIC, etc.) for root cause analysis. Develop and implement effective corrective and preventive measures to ensure similar issues do not recur. Establish and maintain a knowledge base, sharing problem-solving experiences and best practices. Perform other duties as assigned 3. Qualification and Experience Education/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Pharmaceuticals, Chemistry, Industrial Engineering, or related fields. Professional certifications in Operational Excellence or Lean Production (e.g., Lean Six Sigma, Green Belt/Black Belt) are preferred. Job Required Competencies 5 or more years’ operation experience in the pharmaceutical industry, or operational excellence; MNC preferred. Experience in new facility setup or operational transformation projects. Excellent cross-departmental communication and coordination skills, capable of driving collaboration among functional departments. Proficient in process optimization and continuous improvement methodologies, with practical experience in Lean Production and Six Sigma. Familiar with digital tools, strong data analysis skills, with the ability to use database tools and data visualization software for decision-making support. Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution skills to ensure alignment of project goals Fluent communication skills in English and the ability to effectively communicate, collaborate, and foster positive interactions with team members and stakeholders. title: PhD Internship / RiSE - Functional characterization of (re)myelination in acute and organotypic brain slices (12 months)

description.text: Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt. Die Position The RiSE program (Roche Internships for Scientific Exchange) is a highly competitive student research program at Roche. It offers the most talented postgraduate PhD and medical degree students the opportunity to be fully integrated into our interdisciplinary and international industry R&D environment. As a RiSE student you will enhance your competencies, gain valuable work experience with us, and eventually become part of a world-wide network of RiSE Alumni. The Neuroscience and Rare Diseases Discovery and Translational Area (NRD DTA) is developing medicines for a range of serious neurological diseases, including multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer’s disease, Parkinson’s disease, autism, spinal muscular atrophy, and Huntington’s disease. As a RiSE student in the NRD DTA you will join our Neurotransmitter Receptors Lab within the Systems Neuroscience Section at the Roche Innovation Center Basel, Switzerland. You will perform electrophysiological recordings in acute and organotypic brain slice preparations and use advanced labelling and standard molecular biological techniques to functionally assess myelination states in these in-vitro systems. You will be hosted and supervised by a Roche scientist and work as part of an experienced team that will provide guidance and the required infrastructure for your research. The Opportunity Carry out experimental work in the lab in collaboration with a team of scientists, students and research associates Generate acute and organotypic brain slice preparations Perform extracellular electrophysiological recordings from brain slices Conduct (immuno)histochemical labelling and other standard molecular biological experiments Analyze your data and present the results of your research at internal meetings Who You Are You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. Moreover you are/have: Enrolled in a PhD or medical degree program at a university and are looking to expand your experience with an industry internship A strong interest in neurophysiological mechanisms and ideally practical experience with recordings at an electrophysiology setup Hands-on experience with brain tissue dissection and acute brain slice preparation Solid understanding of tissue labelling, immunohistochemistry, cell culture and molecular biological methods Animal experimentation accreditation (LTK1 certificate) would be beneficial Additional Information The preferred start date of the internship is March 2026 or upon availability. Applications need to include a CV and a cover letter, as well as a letter from your academic supervisor supporting your application to the RiSE Program. Additional reference letters and/or transcripts of records would be of advantage. Please note that due to regulations non-EU/EFTA citizens have to provide a certificate from the university stating that an industry internship is mandatory as part of the university training. Curious, motivated, and ready to learn? Apply now for our PhD Internship in Neurophysiology. #RiSE Wer wir sind Eine gesündere Zukunft treibt uns zur Innovation an. Mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit arbeiten gemeinsam daran, wissenschaftliche Fortschritte zu erzielen und sicherzustellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und für zukünftige Generationen. Die Position Gestalten Sie die Zukunft unserer Diagnostics Operations - Ihre Rolle: Hohe Verantwortung und messbarer Impact! Die Abteilung Diagnostics Operations – Projektmanagement ist das strategische Herzstück unserer produktbezogenen Projekte in Penzberg. Wir koordinieren ein breites Portfolio von Projekten, von globalen und lokalen Produkttransfers über Prozessoptimierungen bis hin zu hochkomplexen Designtransfers bei Neueinführungen. Unser Portfolio umfasst innovative molekularbiologische, chemische und biochemische Reagenzien und Kits für Life Science und In-vitro-Diagnostik. Als Project Manager (m/w/d) übernehmen Sie die Gesamtverantwortung für die erfolgreiche Durchführung und Koordination einer Vielzahl von Projekten. Ihr Ziel: Höchste Qualität, termingerechte Fertigstellung der Transfers und Einhaltung des Budgets. Ihre Herausforderungen & Aufgaben Steuern in der Matrix: Sie leiten Projekte hauptsächlich im Umfeld von Produkttransfers von chemischen Einsatzstoffen in unserer komplexen Matrixorganisation. Dabei stellen Sie die bedarfs- und qualifikationsgerechte Besetzung von Projektteams mit Ressourcen aus unterschiedlichen Fachbereichen sicher, um Produkttransfers in eines der modernsten diagnostischen Produktionsgebäude weltweit sicherzustellen. Innovation in die Produktion bringen: Sie koordinieren die reibungslose Übernahme von Reagenzien und Einsatzstoffen aus dem chemischen Produktportfolio sowie aus unseren globalen Entwicklungseinheiten in die neue Produktionsstätte, die in Penzberg entsteht.. Dabei gewährleisten Sie die strikte Einhaltung der Richtlinien zur Herstellbarkeit und Qualität unserer Produkte (DQM). Daher verfügen Sie über solide Kenntnisse der chemischen Produktion für die moderne Labordiagnostik. Transparenz schaffen: Sie verantworten das professionelle Monitoring und Reporting der Projekte. Mithilfe moderner Projektmanagement-Tools ( Monday.com , Planisware, Tableau etc.) erstellen und aktualisieren Sie alle relevanten Planungsdokumente und Berichte. Vernetzen: Sie arbeiten eng und vertrauensvoll mit den lokalen Stakeholdern aus Produktion, Quality und Supportfunktionen sowie den jeweiligen F&E-Einheiten zusammen. Compliance garantieren: Sie sind der Garant dafür, dass alle gesetzlichen Auflagen und internen Richtlinien – insbesondere in Bezug auf Qualitätssicherung, GMP-Anforderungen, Arbeitssicherheit und Umweltschutz – jederzeit erfüllt werden. Ihr Profil Sie sind eine engagierte, analytische und durchsetzungsstarke Persönlichkeit, die bereit ist, in einem dynamischen Umfeld aktiv die Weiterentwicklung unserer Einheit mitzugestalten . Akademische Exzellenz: Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Chemie oder Biochemie bildet Ihr Fundament. Fachexpertise: Sie verfügen über fundierte Erfahrung im Transfer von Produkten zwischen Produktionsstätten und bringen Expertise in der Entwicklung, Qualitätssicherung oder Produktion chemischer/molekularbiologischer Reagenzien oder Systemplattformen mit. Interdisziplinäres Denken: Sie kombinieren Ihr naturwissenschaftliches Wissen mit betriebswirtschaftlichen Kenntnissen. Projektführung: Sie haben nachweisbare Erfahrung in der Leitung von Projekten und im Projektmanagement, idealerweise in der Führung größerer Teams in einer Matrixorganisation. Anpassungsfähigkeit: Sie fühlen sich in einem sich schnell verändernden, komplexen und global vernetzten Umfeld wohl und sind in der Lage, sich flexibel auf neue Situationen einzustellen. Analytische Stärke: Ihre Fähigkeit, Sachverhalte schnell zu strukturieren und sich auf das Wesentliche zu konzentrieren, zeichnet Sie aus. Führungs- & Kommunikationsstärke: Sie übernehmen gerne Verantwortung, arbeiten initiativ und selbstständig. Ihre Kommunikations- und Durchsetzungsfähigkeit setzen Sie gekonnt ein, um auch Konflikte aktiv anzusprechen und im Team tragfähige Lösungen zu diskutieren und umzusetzen. Sprachkenntnisse & Tools: Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sowie ein sicherer Umgang mit gängigen EDV-Systemen sind für Sie selbstverständlich. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicines. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed. The Opportunity As a Project Team Leader (PTL) in Cardiovascular, Metabolism and Immunology (CMI) in pRED, you will act as the project leader for one or more immunology asset teams, assuming full accountability for the development of drug candidates through to pivotal studies. You will lead the team in developing and executing on an asset strategy that delivers on portfolio strategic priorities and maximises value for patients. For the teams you lead, you will: Embed the principles and ways of working for a high performing asset team Lead the team to develop and implement an innovative asset strategy with appropriate data driven stage-gates, de-risking approaches and mitigation strategies Lead co-development projects, balancing the needs of Roche and partners in collaborations Communicate critical data and project team recommendations and decisions to key governance committees and drive stage-gate milestones and budget requests Serve as the interface between CMI in pRED and partner functions on project-related issues Actively engaging with other PTLs and the CMI leadership team to drive portfolio strategy and trade-off decisions Who you are You have led matrix research or development project teams in a complex and fast-paced organization. You have clear and effective communication skills, a deep knowledge of strategic drug development and experience in clinical development. You have demonstrated the ability to influence and align with a diversity of stakeholders in a large organisation and have a track record of shaping decisions without formal authority. You hold a PhD, MD, PharmD, or equivalent experience. You have at least 8 years in the pharmaceutical industry with broad cross-functional experience. You have spent at least 5 of these years in pre-clinical and/or clinical development roles, with pre-clinical and/or early clinical development experience preferred. You have extensive matrix leadership or line leadership experience. You have experience in defining and communicating project strategy in a variety of contexts. A background in the CMI Immunology focus areas of respiratory, gastroenterology or nephrology/rheumatology is preferred. Ready to take the next step? We'd love to hear from you. Manages a defined sales territory to achieve sales and financial targets in accordance with the company's strategic goals. Manages a staff of sales specialists and participates in the establishment of sales and financial goals for a given territory, designing and ensuring implementation of sales plans to achieve these goals. Interacts with sales leadership to communicate sales performance in territory, and cooperates with Marketing to implement promotional strategies and to monitor competitor's activities. Die Position Regulatory Information Specialist Roche India – Roche Services & Solutions Chennai/ Hyderabad A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche. Mission Roche Services & Solutions (RSS) aims at "transforming the way Roche operates.'' As a global organization of over 3,500 colleagues, we enable Roche to operate in a competitive and ever-changing business environment. We provide our partners with end-to-end business services and solutions, enabling them to focus on patient-centric activities. Embracing an OneRoche mindset, we leverage our global network located in Budapest (Hungary), Riga (Latvia), Chennai & Hyderabad (India), San José (Costa Rica), Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia), and our other sites to remain customer-centric 24/7 and co-create solutions together. The Pharma Development Regulatory (PDR) Innovation and Sustainment Chapter is responsible for developing and sustaining business capabilities within PDR. We focus on fostering innovation, ensuring operational readiness, and implementing continuous improvements. Our team anticipates regulatory landscape changes and evaluates future business needs to achieve PDR's moonshots and Pharma vision. We maintain compliant, efficient regulatory processes, systems, and tools to meet patient and business needs, and understand the impact of data and information on submission quality. As a member of this chapter, you will leverage talent across PDR to drive innovation, lead continuous improvement, and oversee regulations and internal standards. Your responsibilities include assessing processes, tools, and technology to achieve our business goals, collaborating enterprise-wide to ensure compliance, and partnering with quality organizations across PD, affiliates, Pharma, and Roche. As a Regulatory Information Specialist , you will manage the intake, analysis, and archiving of official correspondence between the company and global Health Authorities. You will ensure that our Regulatory Information Management (RIM) database remains the "single source of truth," maintaining high standards of data integrity and compliance to support audit readiness and drug development milestones. You will play a pivotal role in transforming unstructured FDA regulatory documents into structured, actionable intelligence. The Opportunity You process and upload regulatory correspondence (letters, emails, meeting minutes) into the RIM system with 100% accuracy, ensuring documents are filed according to eCTD structure. You review incoming documents to correctly categorize metadata and identify specific "agency commitments" or deadlines to flag for relevant stakeholders. You perform deep-dive data extraction from FDA Summary Basis of Approval (SBA) reviews, capturing pivotal trial designs, sample sizes, and dosing regimens. You accurately record primary/secondary endpoints and statistical outcomes (e.g. P-values, Hazard Ratios, Confidence Intervals). You identify and extract key regulatory milestones, such as breakthrough designations, orphan drug status, and RMAT. You document Advisory Committee meeting dates, voting outcomes, and key discussion points from FDA briefing materials. You maintain database integrity by cross-referencing data across multiple FDA sources (e.g., Drugs@FDA) to ensure consistency and standardized nomenclature. You assist in internal audits and health authority inspections by providing rapid retrieval of requested documentation. Who You Are You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree or Pharm D in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, Clinical Research, or an equivalent field. You have 2–4 years of experience in Regulatory Operations, Document Management, or a related clinical research/regulatory affairs role. You have a foundational understanding of the drug development lifecycle and the role of health authorities such as the FDA, EMA etc.. You possess strong FDA Literacy , with familiarity in the structure of FDA approval packages for both CDER and CBER. You have a solid clinical understanding, including the ability to interpret trial results and terms like double-blind, non-inferiority, and ITT analysis. You are proficient with RIM software (e.g., Veeva Vault) , Microsoft Excel, and Google Sheets; you are a quick learner of new technologies. You demonstrate meticulous attention to detail (e.g., distinguishing between a 0.05 and 0.005) and a "right-first-time" approach to data entry. You have strong written English skills for summarizing complex regulatory decisions and are comfortable managing high volumes of documentation under tight timelines. A certification in a Regulatory Affairs course (e.g., PG diploma) is considered an asset. Where pay transparency applies, details are provided based on the primary posting location. For this role, the primary location is Hyderabad. If you are interested in additional locations where the role may be available, we will provide the relevant compensation details later in the hiring process. Die Position Bei Roche Digital Technology (RDT) bauen wir auf die 125-jährige Geschichte von Roche als eines der weltweit größten Biotech-Unternehmen auf, das für die Bereitstellung transformativer innovativer Lösungen in wichtigen Krankheitsbereichen bekannt ist. Wir kombinieren menschliche Fähigkeiten mit hochmodernen technologischen Innovationen, um jetzt das zu tun, was unsere Patienten als Nächstes brauchen. Sei Teil unseres integrativen Teams bei Roche ITOT (Information Technology & Operational Technology), welches die Bereiche Planung, Lager, Produktion, Freigabe und Distribution durch technologische Neuerungen und optimale IT-Lösungen vorantreibt. Deine Chance In deiner Tätigkeit als SAP ERP Engineer (m/w/d) im Bereich ITOT ERP Systems Support liegt der Schwerpunkt deiner Aufgaben im Support der mit dem “ASPIRE” Projekt eingeführten SAP Systeme S/4HANA und SAP EWM. Mit der Betreuung der Produktions- und Logistiksysteme, stellst du den störungsfreien Produktionsbetrieb, den Warenfluss im Lager, sowie die Produktionsversorgung der Pharma Sterilproduktion Mannheim sicher. Dich erwartet ein flexibles Team, das sich durch enge Zusammenarbeit im systemübergreifenden Support auszeichnet und immer Wege findet, neue oder sich ändernde End-to-End Prozesse im System abzubilden. Dabei sind wir immer auf der Suche nach potentiellen Verbesserungen und gehen deren Umsetzung proaktiv und unter Anwendung von LEAN-Methoden an. Konkret lassen sich deine Aufgaben wie folgt beschreiben: Bearbeitung von Fragen und Problemen von Systemanwendern als 1st Level Support in den genannten Systemen, sowie deren Schnittstellen Analyse und kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung der Business Prozesse der betreuten Fachbereiche unter Berücksichtigung von GMP-Anforderungen Erfolgreiche Initiierung und Umsetzung von Systemänderungen in Abstimmung mit den Fachbereichen und dem Produktmanagement. Durchführung von Systemtests sowie System- und Prozessoptimierungen unter Einhaltung der CSV-Regularien Vertreten der ITOT-Gruppe im Bereich Pharma, sowie in regionalen Gremien. Wer Du bist Du bist besonders kundenorientiert und brennst für das Thema Business Analysis und Consulting. Des Weiteren siehst Du das große Ganze und stellst Dinge gerne konstruktiv in Frage. Mit deinem “Growth Mindset”, deiner extremen Lernmotivation und -fähigkeit konntest du bereits Erfolge feiern. Folgende Kompetenzen und Qualifikationen beschreiben dich ebenso sehr passend: Du verfügst über einen Hochschulabschluss in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation. Du bringst tiefgreifendes Wissen in den pharmazeutischen Planungs-, Logistik- und besonders in Lagerprozessen im GMP-regulierten Umfeld mit und konntest in dieser Umgebung bereits mehrjährige Erfahrung mit IT-Applikationen sammeln. Du hast Erfahrung im Management von bereichsübergreifenden lokalen und globalen Projekten im Zusammenhang mit SAP S/4HANA oder SAP EWM. Des Weiteren bist du es gewohnt, Teamarbeit in Matrixorganisationen erfolgreich zu fördern und bei hoher Belastung eigeninitiativ, ergebnisorientiert sowie kunden- und serviceorientiert zu bleiben - ohne die Qualität zu vernachlässigen. Die Position The Position: Search & Evaluation Lead in China for Research Technologies Partnering As a leader in healthcare, we are dedicated to pioneering groundbreaking science and technology that can transform the lives of patients worldwide. To achieve this mission, we make a greater investment in R&D than any other healthcare company globally. External innovation, alongside our extensive internal pipeline, is a cornerstone of our R&D strategy. In the current healthcare landscape, strong collaborations are more critical than ever, and being aware of the innovation in modalities and discovery technologies in China is more important than ever before. The Opportunity: The Corporate Business Development (CBD) organization supports the Roche Group with a wide range of global partnerships, including those for R&D with opportunities at all stages (discovery to Ph 3), technology platform tools, and commercial deals. Those partnerships start with the identification of the right opportunities that fit our strategy. For discovery partnerships, for which Research Technologies Partnering is accountable, the identification of highly differentiated modality or technology platforms are key, based on an understanding why they push the frontier of science to help create novel medicines otherwise not possible. The identification of novel opportunities is spearheaded by our Search & Evaluation experts within CBD. For Research Technologies Partnering, covering novel technology and modality platforms, these are predominantly our 3 research organizations pRED, gRED and CICoR, and for specific needs like drug delivery also our global technical development organization. As Search & Evaluation Lead in China you are working with the global Research Technologies Partnering team, and specifically the Search & Evaluation Lead based in Basel, as well as stakeholders to source and identify opportunities in China across a broad range of modalities and to enable their timely evaluation. You report to the Global Head of Research Technologies Partnering. More specifically, the expectations for this role are: ● Be knowledgeable across a broad range of modalities, or be able to learn about modality areas quickly ● Be able to differentiate what is cutting-edge science developed by a given biotech ● Be or become a student of the Chinese ecosystem and the pace of innovation across modalities as well as geographic hotspots in China for platform innovation, including the IIT network enabling fast iterations on modality platforms ● Become a Go-to person for biotechs in China working on innovative platforms ● Collaborate with Search & Evaluation Leads for the Therapy Area asset partnering teams and the Asia Partnering team when interacting with Chinese biotechs offering both pipeline assets and platform capabilities ● Exchange with the Head of the Roche Accelerator in Shanghai to stay abreast of platform opportunities and advancements Responsibilities: ● Understand internal modality capabilities and adress identified innovation gaps through sourcing of platform opportunities ● As applicable, perform comprehensive landscaping on technology platform topics in the Chinese ecosystem --> Contribute to decision-making following the completion of defined modality landscapes ● Contribute to the non-confidential and initial confidential review of defined opportunities, as applicable ● Triage efficiently any opportunistic inquiries from Chinese biotechs ● Identify a mechanism for regular check-ins on platform developments with prioritized biotechs given the speed of development in China ● Contribute to deep connections with VC firms in China to be at the forefront of novel biotechs being generated ● Attend and prepare for scientific and partnering conferences in China, including academic scientific symposia and provide synopsis from such conferences ● Develop relationships with key academic researchers/universities to understand the forefront of science in China’s academic setting ● Present ecosystem analysis or specific opportunities to the Research Technologies Team and to stakeholders ● Document opportunities in CBD’s DASH database Who you are: We are hiring a Search & Evaluation Lead for Research Technologies Partnering in China. The exact level will be determined based on candidates skills and experience related to the role or other skills sets needed for the position. ● 7 years in pharma/biotech; experience in Business Development & Licensing (BD&L) / Corporate Development or VC environment preferred ● Scientific background - advanced degree in life sciences or medicine, or data science (e.g., MD, PhD, PharmD) ● Demonstrated understanding of drug discovery and development Skills & Characteristics ● Strong scientific acumen, self-motivation, and a genuine interest in following novel science and emerging innovation trends ● Energetic, results-driven individual with a strong executive presence and collaborative mindset. ● Great english oral and written communication, fluent in Chinese and Mandarin. ● Skillful presenter of scientific information Relocation benefits are not available for this position. title: Senior Associate (m/w/d) Gene Therapy mit Fokus auf funktionaler Charakterisierung

description.text: Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt. Die Position Im Bereich Pharma Technical Characterization Gx (PTCG) gestaltest Du die Zukunft der medizinischen Versorgung aktiv mit. Wir sind verantwortlich für die technische Entwicklung von in vivo Gentherapeutika in der präklinischen und klinischen Phase. Dabei bilden wir das entscheidende Bindeglied zwischen der Pharma-Forschung und der Qualitätskontrolle für Marktprodukte. Das Team Unsere Funktion „Gentherapie-Analytik“ konzentriert sich auf die analytische Charakterisierung, Qualitätskontrolle sowie die Implementierung neuartiger Technologien – von der präklinischen Studie bis zur Marktzulassung (BLA) und Markteinführung. Werde Teil eines hochmotivierten, agilen und interdisziplinären Teams, das gemeinsam an smarten Lösungen für die nächste Generation therapeutischer Modalitäten arbeitet. Die Möglichkeiten In dieser vielseitigen Rolle liegt Dein Fokus auf analytischen Methoden für die Testung und Charakterisierung von viralen Vektoren und Plasmiden: Inn ovation treiben: Du verantwortest das Scouting, die Evaluierung und die Implementierung innovativer Methoden (z. B. digitale PCR, funktionelle Bioassays, NGS) für die Analyse von viralen Vektoren (vorwiegend rAAV). Technologien vorantreiben: Du forcierst die funktionelle Charakterisierung und Quantifizierung in einem modernen Laborumfeld. Praktische Expertise : Du führst Experimente selbstständig durch – von der Methodenentwicklung über die Gerätequalifizierung bis zur Test-Validierung unter GMP-Anforderungen. Strategische Mitwirkung: Du unterstützt bei der Definition von Kontroll- und Prüfstrategien für gentherapeutische Vektoren. Datenmanagement: Du interpretierst, bewertest und dokumentierst Daten sowie Analyseberichte gemäß den geltenden regulatorischen Vorschriften. Wer Du bist Du bist eine eigenmotivierte Persönlichkeit mit einem hohen Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Freude an der Arbeit im Team: Ausbildung: Du hast Dein Studium der Chemie, Biochemie, Biologie, Virologie, Pharmazie oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung erfolgreich abgeschlossen. Erfahrung: Idealerweise bringst Du mehr als 3 Jahre praktische und theoretische Erfahrung auf dem Gebiet der Molekularbiologie oder Virologie mit. Idealerweise bringst Du relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Digital Health oder Diagnostik mit. Fachwissen: Du besitzt fundierte Kenntnisse in Zellkultur, Transfektion, Potenztests, Durchflusszytometrie sowie in PCR-Techniken (qPCR, dPCR, RT-PCR). Methodik: Du bist sicher in der statistischen Auswertung pharmakologischer Tests und hast idealerweise Erfahrung mit molekularbiologischen Techniken wie Western Blot oder NGS. Regulatorik: Du bist vertraut mit den Grundsätzen der GMP (Datenintegrität, Methodenvalidierung). Sprachen : Du kommunizierst sicher in Deutsch und/oder Englisch. Diese Position ist für 2 Jahre befristet. Deine Bewerbung Wir machen’s einfach: Bitte lade online nur Deinen aktuellen Lebenslauf hoch. Here's what we're looking for: We are seeking a dedicated and expert Medical Doctor with academic experience to join our team as a Senior Medical Solutions Manager / Senior Clinical Evaluation Manager, focusing on our cutting-edge Diabetes Care and Diagnostics portfolio. You bring strong experince with clincial evaluations and can serve as a subject matter expert in the team. This critical role serves as the medical and clinical authority for our diabetes-related devices, including Medical Device Software, Insulin Pumps and Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems. You will be responsible for leading the clinical evaluation of our products, generating and appraising clinical data, and engaging with key stakeholders across the healthcare ecosystem. You will contribute to authoring Medical Risk Assessments for assays, a wide range of IVDs and laboratory products. Your expertise will directly influence product strategy, ensure patient safety, and drive the adoption of our life-changing technologies. Your upcoming mission: Data Generation & Clinical Support: Author and lead the clinical evaluation efforts for Diabetes Care devices, including pumps and CGMs, ensuring alignment with regulatory requirements. Provide expert medical input for critical safety and regulatory documents, including Clinical Evaluation Reports, Medical Risk Assessments (MRA), and Risk Enablers. Identify local data gaps and lead data generation activities; design and oversee Post-Market Clinical Follow-Up (PMCF) plans and studies. Serve as a Study Safety Officer for assigned clinical trials, ensuring the well-being of participants and the integrity of study data. Serve as MRA author for assays, IVDs and laboratory products. Stakeholder Engagement & Scientific Exchange: Develop and cultivate robust, long-term strategic relationships with internal colleagues, clinicians, research institutions, and other key external stakeholders in the diabetes field. Drive high-impact knowledge exchange and data communication to ensure the medical community is informed of the latest scientific advancements and clinical data for our devices. Cross-Functional Collaboration & Compliance: Provide deep medical expertise and collaborate closely with internal teams, including Clinical Operations, Regulatory Affairs, pre- and post-Market Quality, Market Access, and Commercial. Participate in and provide medical support for interactions with national Health Authorities and Notified Bodies. Ensure all medical activities are conducted with the highest ethical standards and in full compliance with all applicable laws, regulations (e.g., MDR), and company procedures. Qualifications and Experience : A Medical Degree (MD) is strongly preferred; PhDs with significant experience in clinical evaluations are a plus! An extended skill set and academic or industry experience in Diabetes and/or a related field is required. Proven experience in a relevant role within the pharmaceutical, medical device, or biotechnology industry (e.g., Clinical Evaluator for medical devices). Solid understanding of the Diabetes and its technical and medical state-of-the-art. Solid understanding of the CGM business and its technical and medical state-of-the-art. Demonstrated experience in developing and managing relationships with teams and experts in the Diabetes or related space. Strong understanding of clinical trial design, data analysis, and pharmacovigilance/device safety. Experience with clinical trial safety oversight as a Study Safety Officer is a significant asset. Strategic mindset with the ability to translate complex scientific and technical concepts into actionable plans. Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. A true team player is a must. Fluency in English is required. Proficiency in German is highly advantageous. The Position Sequencing Bioinformatics Specialist The Opportunity: As a Sequencing Bioinformatics Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Sequencing & Life Sciences franchise at Roche. This position focuses on bioinformatics as it relates to the Sequencing instruments and associated products within the Roche Sequencing portfolio. You will contribute to the growth and success of accounts ranging from Commercial Sequencing Providers to Academic Medical Centers, Large Reference Labs, Molecular Pathology Labs, Biotech, Pharma, and Universities. These institutions leverage genomic methods, including next-generation sequencing (NGS), in both research and clinical applications. Key Responsibilities: Sales Engagement & Expertise: Drive achievement of sales quotas by actively engaging in sales activities. Provide technical expertise throughout the sales process. Offer effective consultations on applications, assay design, data analysis, and interpretation. Strategic Sales Planning & Implementation: Develop and execute strategic sales plans to meet revenue targets and grow market share. Technical Presentations & Consultations: Deliver product presentations, demonstrations, and in-depth consultative discussions. Key technical areas include: Sample preparation for sequencing. NGS data analysis, management, sharing, and storage. Analysis, annotation, interpretation, and reporting of NGS testing for clinical and research settings. Integration of Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) across workflows. Cloud-based pipeline optimization and automation. Bioinformatics approaches tailored to specific genomic applications. Cross-Functional & Team Collaboration: Align with Sequencing Sales Specialists, Genomic Solutions Specialists, and Regional Business Managers to implement strategic territory plans. Train local sales teams and support colleagues to enhance sales of sequencing platforms and informatics solutions. Work closely with marketing, product management, and service/support teams to align sales efforts with organizational goals and customer needs. Customer Engagement & Representation: Serve as a trusted advisor to customers, offering guidance to overcome informatics challenges and achieve their scientific goals. Represent Roche at conferences, trade shows, and networking events to enhance brand awareness and thought leadership. Market Insight & Adaptation: Stay ahead of industry trends, market dynamics, and competitive landscapes to refine sales strategies and seize new business opportunities. This is a National field-based role. Candidate can be based anywhere in the U.S. Relocation assistance is not provided for this role. Travel Requirements: Estimate travel 25-50% of the time. You seek opportunities to work across functions and geographies, preferring a role that serves as a launchpad for development rather than a static title. You hold a Bachelor's Degree degree in Bioinformatics, Molecular Biology, Genetics, or Biochemistry or equivalent experience. You hold 5 years relevant sales experience, Bioinformatics experience or equivalent experience. Technical Expertise: Deep knowledge of next-generation sequencing (NGS) technologies, platforms, methodologies, and applications. Proficiency in sequencing data analysis and interpretation, including primary, secondary, and tertiary analysis workflows. Expertise in clinical informatics, bioinformatics, or adjacent fields. Familiarity with sequencing applications (current and emerging), data formats, file types, data footprints, and analysis methods. Solid understanding of life sciences markets, coupled with the ability to identify customer needs and articulate value propositions. Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with an ability to convey complex scientific concepts to varied audiences. Self-motivated, proactive, and results-oriented, with a proven track record of exceeding sales targets. Ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic, fast-changing environment. Die Position Relocation benefits are not available for this job posting. The Opportunity: In this position, you will be responsible for searching, gathering, drafting, analyzing, reviewing and maintaining Genentech’s Managed Care Contracts. This work includes effectively working with Contract Managers and other internal partners in reviewing contract needs and requirements in alignment with Genentech’s contracting strategies, business objectives, and compliance requirements. Communication & Contracting Excellence: Synthesizes complex information into clear, concise, actionable communications; drafts and explains contract terms with strong comprehension of legal and business implications; and prepares baseline contracts, amendments, notices, and revised drafts. Adaptability & Independent Execution: Thrives in ambiguity, embraces change, and demonstrates strong prioritization and autonomy—effectively managing tasks such as gathering contract documentation, entering data in CLM systems, and responding to ad hoc requests. Collaboration & Relationship Building: Builds trusting relationships with internal partners and stakeholders, contributing to a collaborative environment that supports smooth contract operations and cross-functional alignment. Continuous Improvement & Agile Mindset: Embeds continuous improvement, agility, and collective leadership principles in day-to-day work, driving efficiency, accuracy, and operational excellence across contracting workflows. Technical & Industry Knowledge: Possesses—or can quickly acquire—working understanding of the U.S. healthcare system and managed care segments, various contract types, Genentech products, and contract-related systems to execute responsibilities effectively and consistently. Required Qualifications Education & Experience: Bachelor’s degree with at least 3 years of relevant or transferable work experience, including prior experience in contract drafting and the ability to learn policies and guidelines impacting contracts. Technical Proficiency: High level of expertise with Microsoft Office and Google Workspace, with the capability to work efficiently across digital tools and systems. Communication & Collaboration: Strong communication skills and demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively across diverse teams and settings. Performance & Results: Proven track record of meeting or exceeding objectives and goals, showing reliability, accountability, and consistency in execution. Die Position Workflow & IT Specialist (based North of Portugal) Roche Diagnostics, Portugal As an Engineer at Roche, you’ll be working on challenges that have an impact on millions of people. We have a wide range of departments where engineering expertise is business critical. From developing new kinds of devices, maintaining our diagnostics machines in the field, setting up and keeping our production facilities running, to ensuring that our infrastructure enables all colleagues at Roche to pursue our common goal: to improve the lives of patients. The Opportunity Reporting to the Workflow & IT Area Manager in Portugal, the Workflow & IT Specialist will be responsible for the installation and maintenance of pre-analytical systems and IT systems marketed by Roche according to customer and business requirements and needs, ensuring a high level of excellence in the service provided by Roche, actively collaborating in the evolution of the business and enabling the best user experience for our customers within microbiology, pathology and clinical chemistry laboratories in Portugal. Main responsibilities: Conduct implementation projects using appropriate and efficient methodologies. Maintain broad knowledge to effectively diagnose, solve and implement IT & Workflow solutions to support laboratory effectiveness and efficiency Provide education, training and technical expertise on portfolio with demonstrations and configuration of IT products. Prepare, install and configure the systems according to customer requirements and needs. Execute preventive maintenance, modifications and corrective actions of IT systems. Provide on-site as well as phone support to customers regarding our IT solutions. Define and order interfaces between our instruments or Information Solutions and 3rd party host systems. Advise on systems process optimisation and liaise with customers IT functions regarding IT policies, security standards, and other requirements that might impact the use of our solutions Gather and analyse information to effectively support customers in their daily operations. Analyse root causes of failures in the IT & Workflow solutions Identify critical customer situations and report them internally. Report quality and operational issues of systems and/or products to Roche support centers and initiate necessary actions. Who you are You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. You are willing to work in an intercultural environment, support your colleagues but also learn from them. University Degree in Information Technology required (or similar area). You have a solid understanding and knowledge about IT infrastructure and network communications. Ideally you have experience in working with IVD/IVDR products or in a hospital environment and troubleshooting complex integrated IT solutions (highly appreciated) With a Service mindset focused on creating value and delivering results according to business and customer needs, you are curious and inquisitive, and have excellent analytical, problem analysis and decision-making skills. Organised and a skilled problem-solver with a strong sense of urgency, you like to solve problems by yourself or with a team, adapting to the circumstances. With effective planning, prioritisation and time management skills, you are able to plan and perform detailed work, following guidelines but also find new ways and solutions. You are collaborative and demonstrate ability and willingness to create trustful relations with customers and colleagues. You possess good communication skills in both Portuguese and English (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills with ability to communicate at all levels The next step is yours! Apply by February 8th, 2026.
